posts.content:
“You are your best advocate. Your voice matters, and your story is important.” – Michelle Obama.

“Getting our Voice Heard” – we all need help with this at times, isn’t it? That’s what our recent WISE Program ( Women’s Initiative for Success and Empowerment) focused on. 
 
Oliver Skagerlind, our Chief Digital Information Officer joined us to engage with our Women folks and share his perspective on Women’s Empowerment in the Workplace. 

He spoke about his personal story, the influence of women leadership on his career journey and some key traits that help women navigate through some common workplace challenges to pave their way to success, whilst balancing their multiple responsibilities. 

Our WISE Program is a 4-month development journey, tailored for women at DAMAC, addressing the distinctive challenges they encounter in personal and professional domains and enabling them to flourish in their roles.

posts.content:
This is a masterclass you don’t want to miss. 

Watching Roger Federer speak to university students made me sit up and wonder—can we admire and respect him even more than we already do? 

His words took me back to every master I’ve ever seen in action—whether on screen, in an office, or on the sports field. 

Federer, one of the greatest athletes of all time, didn’t just play tennis—he created magic with a racquet in hand. But through his speech, he reminds us that what seemed like magic was actually the product of relentless dedication and an unshakable work ethic. 

People thought he barely broke a sweat. Yet behind what the world saw as effortless genius was a man who spent countless hours practicing, strategizing, and failing. 

That effortlessness? It’s a myth. 

Much like Virat Kohli’s cover drive or Rohit Sharma’s pull shot. We assume it's pure talent, but in reality, they’ve practiced those shots a million times. 

The same applies to fitness. There’s no magic formula. It’s years—decades—of clean eating, disciplined training, and consistent effort. 

It never gets easier. You just get better. 

Whether we’re entrepreneurs, professionals, or artists, the lesson is clear—true mastery is not about ease but about persistence. 

The ease you see is hard-earned. 

"It's only a point," Federer said. In tennis, just like in life, not every serve goes our way. What matters is what we do next. 

Do you dwell on the missed shot, or do you prepare for the next one? 

Despite his global fame and near-mythical status, Federer speaks about life’s richness beyond the court. There’s something deeply humbling in how he calls himself a father first, cherishing simple joys like driving his kids to school. 

His speech was more than just a pep talk for students. It was a masterclass in resilience, discipline, and perspective—the very principles that built one of the greatest sporting legacies. 

Everything he said is a guide to winning at life. With grace. With excellence. 🤩

posts.content:
The biggest bottleneck in your career isn't skill,

It's this:

You can have all the experience, training, and opportunities -

And still stay stuck if your mindset holds you there.

The good news is you can fix that.

The shift starts small:
A few words you swap in your own head.

Small edits with massive impact.

These 7 mindset shifts change everything:

1. I'm not ready → I'll learn as I go
↳Readiness is a myth. Momentum makes you capable
↳Action: Write down the first 2 messy steps and do them before you feel ready

2. This is a problem → This is a puzzle
↳One feels heavy, the other invites curiosity
↳Action: Ask, "What are 3 possible ways this could work?" before labeling it stuck

3. What if I mess up? → I've practiced for this
↳Fear shifts to focus when you see the reps behind you
↳Action: Keep a "reps list" of past situations you handled well and reread it before big moments

4. I don't know how → I can learn how
↳A skill gap is temporary. A fixed belief is permanent
↳Action: Block 20 minutes to watch or read one resource today

5. This won't work → I'll find a way
↳A test, not a dead end
↳Action: List one fallback option before you start - now you have safety to move

6. This is a risk → This is an opportunity
↳Same facts, different emotional weight
↳Action: Write the best case scenario on paper. Keep it visible while you decide

7. I failed → I learned
↳A mistake shows you what to fix, it doesn't define you
↳Action: After any setback, ask: "What's the 1 thing I'd do differently next time?"


Big changes usually start with small mental edits.

Which of these do you need most right now?

---

♻️ Share this to inspire others to shift their mindset.

And follow me George Stern for more.

posts.content:
𝗪𝗵𝗲𝗿𝗲 𝗛𝗮𝘃𝗲 𝗜 𝗦𝗲𝗲𝗻 𝗧𝗵𝗶𝘀 𝗕𝗲𝗳𝗼𝗿𝗲?
This is the most crucial question to ask during a semiotic study. Semiotics is the study of how signs and symbols create and communicate meaning.

A small example from everyday life: at my local supermarket, every price tag is black text on a yellow background. In semiotics, black and yellow together often mean warning, caution, or urgency: think hazard signs, bees, wasps, and certain snakes. In retail, that same color combination often signals discounts or special offers. So when you see it, you instinctively think bargain.

But here’s the trick; when every price tag uses that color scheme, it creates the illusion that everything is on sale, even when it’s not. Check the receipt, and the illusion disappears. A subtle, clever piece of retail psychology.

Semiotics helps us ask not just what something means, but:
• Where did this meaning come from?
• Why is it being used here?
• What reaction was it meant to provoke?
• What does it remind people of?

It’s a way of tracing cultural cues back to their origins, understanding how they’ve found their way into our everyday perceptions.

Grateful to Dr Rachel Lawes and Panos Dimitropoulos for opening my eyes to the ways semiotics shapes retail, shopping, and even the clever tricks that have us buying things we never planned to.

posts.content:
Pixar’s Elio just delivered the studio’s weakest box office debut—a surprise, given its glowing reviews. But it’s also a mirror to a wider shift in global storytelling.

Original films are up against towering franchises and reboots that dominate attention, marketing, and revenue. Here's what’s fueling this transformation in how we watch—and what we choose to watch:

𝗙𝗮𝗺𝗶𝗹𝗶𝗮𝗿𝗶𝘁𝘆 𝗧𝗵𝗿𝗼𝘂𝗴𝗵 𝗔𝗹𝗴𝗼𝗿𝗶𝘁𝗵𝗺𝘀
Streaming services lean into known titles. Their recommendation engines reward the predictable, nudging audiences away from fresh ideas.

𝗛𝘆𝗽𝗲𝗿-𝗖𝘂𝗿𝗮𝘁𝗲𝗱 𝗖𝗼𝗻𝘀𝘂𝗺𝗽𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻
Viewers now craft their own entertainment ecosystems. In a world of niche tastes, shared experiences often come from big franchise events.

𝗧𝗵𝗲 𝗦𝗲𝗾𝘂𝗲𝗹 𝗚𝗲𝗻𝗲𝗿𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻
Younger viewers were raised in cinematic universes. Their cultural memories are shaped by continuity—and studios are meeting that demand with more of the same.

𝗕𝗼𝗿𝗱𝗲𝗿𝗹𝗲𝘀𝘀 𝗕𝗹𝗼𝗰𝗸𝗯𝘂𝘀𝘁𝗲𝗿𝘀
Franchise films are easier to market across global markets. Big-budget originals face a steeper climb when they don’t come with built-in recognition.

𝗠𝗼𝘃𝗶𝗲 𝗠𝗶𝘀𝘀-𝗢𝘂𝘁
Going to the movies needs to feel like an experience worth having. Blockbusters create urgency and conversation. Originals? They need to work harder to be seen.

𝗢𝗿𝗶𝗴𝗶𝗻𝗮𝗹𝗶𝘁𝘆 𝘀𝘁𝗶𝗹𝗹 𝗵𝗮𝘀 𝗮 𝗽𝗹𝗮𝗰𝗲—𝗯𝘂𝘁 𝘄𝗶𝘁𝗵𝗼𝘂𝘁 𝘀𝘁𝗿𝗮𝘁𝗲𝗴𝗶𝗰 𝗻𝘂𝗿𝘁𝘂𝗿𝗶𝗻𝗴, 𝗶𝘁 𝗿𝗶𝘀𝗸𝘀 𝗯𝗲𝗰𝗼𝗺𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗮 𝗻𝗶𝗰𝗵𝗲 𝗿𝗮𝘁𝗵𝗲𝗿 𝘁𝗵𝗮𝗻 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗻𝗼𝗿𝗺. 𝗪𝗵𝗮𝘁 𝘄𝗶𝗹𝗹 𝗶𝘁 𝘁𝗮𝗸𝗲 𝘁𝗼 𝗺𝗮𝗸𝗲 𝗻𝗲𝘄 𝗶𝗱𝗲𝗮𝘀 𝗳𝗲𝗲𝗹 𝗹𝗶𝗸𝗲 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗺𝗮𝗶𝗻 𝗲𝘃𝗲𝗻𝘁 𝗮𝗴𝗮𝗶𝗻?

International visitors are increasingly treating China as a premier shopping destination, drawn by a mix of tradition and innovation. From handcrafted teacups to folding-screen smartphones, foreign tourists are making shopping a key part of their travel experience.

With visa-free travel expanding and social media fueling “China tours,” foreign visitors are embracing a “tourism plus shopping” model. During the May Day holiday, foreign arrivals surged by 43.1%, with spending in Shanghai alone soaring 211.6% year-on-year.

Tax refunds, seamless mobile payments, and the global appeal of “Made in China” products—from smart home devices to silk attire—are transforming China into a premier shopping destination. Some travelers even organize group shopping trips, ensuring they return home with the latest innovations and cultural treasures.

As accessibility improves, China’s retail landscape is becoming an increasingly powerful draw for global consumers. 

Source: Xinhua https://lnkd.in/eBVH-7im

✴️The 
hashtag

✴️ Taking 
hashtag

5️⃣ Ask for help when you need it.

posts.content:
Like many of you, I was deeply saddened to hear about the tragic crash of Air India Flight Al171, which was on its way from Ahmedabad to London.

The flight had 242 people on board (230 passengers and 12 crew members)-included 169 Indian nationals, 53 British nationals, 7 Portuguese nationals, and 1 Canadian national- and sadly, there are no known survivors.

People from different parts of the world were on that flight. Behind every name was a family, a story, a future... and someone waiting for them to come home. 
It's hard to put into words how deeply painful this is even for those of us not directly connected. Grief like this reminds us just how fragile life really is.

In moments like these, I we should remember. Life is unpredictable - and incredibly precious.

Let us all take a quiet moment today to reflect, to be grateful for life, and to extend kindness to those around us

posts.content:
🏆 Embracing Resilience – My First ICN Experience at 43! 🏆

At the age of 43, stepping onto the ICN stage for the first time was a dream come true. This journey wasn’t just about competing; it was a test of resilience, discipline, and personal growth. I’m incredibly proud to share memorable experiences of my life & few medals as well 😎

Fit couple - Gold (Partner - Shilpa Kansal)
Men's Runway Model - Gold
Transformation Male - Gold
Men's Fitness 30+ - Bronze 
Men's Fitness First Timer - 5th

Achieving this milestone wouldn’t have been possible without the unwavering support and guidance of some exceptional people:
✨ My Fitness Coach, Co-Founder at Fittr & INFS Bala Dabbedi 
✨ My Posing Coach, IT Professional & fitness enthusiast Mathanagopalan Ravichandran 
✨ ICN President, Jay Acharya
✨ My Family, A special thank you to my family for their unconditional support throughout this journey. 
Shilpa Kansal 

This experience has been a powerful reminder of the importance of resilience—a quality that extends far beyond the fitness world. In our careers and personal lives, resilience empowers us to embrace challenges, adapt to change, and strive for excellence, no matter the circumstances.

To everyone reading this: whether it's stepping onto a stage, taking on a new career challenge, or pursuing a passion, it’s never too late to push your boundaries. Age, like any obstacle, is just a number.

I am deeply grateful for this journey and for the opportunity to experience the joy of competing, the satisfaction of overcoming hurdles, and the pride of achieving what once seemed impossible.

Here’s to resilience, growth, and the pursuit of our dreams! 💪🌟

PS - For more pics, feel free to visit/follow (zoomdeepak1)

After 7 plus incredible years at KONE, I am grateful for the growth, purpose and people that shaped my journey. From leading strategic hiring to being part of a company driven by integrity and innovation.

I am now excited to begin a new chapter as Director Talent Acquisition at DAMAC Group.

With over four decades of redefining luxury, from iconic towers and master planned communities to global collaborations in fashion and lifestyle, DAMAC blends scale with vision.

As DAMAC accelerates across real estate, data centers, hospitality, retail and tech driven ventures, I am energised by the opportunity to help shape the leadership and talent that will drive its next chapter.

posts.content:
What's Driving the Budget? For developers, understanding construction costs is not optional—it is essential. Every project depends on tracking material, labor, and equipment price trends. That is where construction cost indices come in. They provide real-time insights, helping developers budget smarter and avoid surprises.

Instead of guessing, they can predict. Fewer cost overruns, better negotiations, and transparency.

Cost indices ensure fair escalation clauses and cost transparency, offering flexibility in a fluctuating market. But they need careful management to avoid discrepancies. In short, cost indices turn curiosity into clarity—and clarity into control.

posts.content:
Some events stay with you long after they are over-SheForShe was one of them.

Throughout my career, I have often been one of the few women in the room and have been fortunate to have the chance to speak up, contribute, and be heard. But like anyone, I havehad moments where I doubted myself, questioned my place, and felt the weight of being different. These experiences have shaped how I listen, speak, and lead.

Hearing so many women share their raw, unfiltered stories reminded me of the power in being vulnerable. When we feel safe enough to show up as ourselves, it creates something truly powerful.

Yes, I still believe capability should drive business. But I also believe diverse teams ask better questions and find better answers. That’s not just good for people—it’s good for results.

Nezha Alaoui thank you for having me- it was a pleasure to connect.

#daywellspent

posts.content:
Let’s test something. Go to your favorite 5 star hotel’s Instagram page or booking listing. Count how many photos you see of the breakfast buffet, the spa lobby, or a latte with perfectly dusted cocoa art. Now count how many pictures you find of the gym.

Exactly.

As someone who has spent over 20 years in this industry, opening hotels, rebranding them, building their reputations, and creating content pretty much 24/7, I still find myself baffled by this particular blind spot. We spend fortunes on treadmills, wellness consultants, Technogym equipment, even scented towels. And then… we don’t show it?

I just got back from my staycation and yes, I was reminded, again, of what I wanted to rant about.

Here’s the thing. I’m not a fitness influencer. But I am a hotel guest. And when I book my stay, I look at three things in this order:
 1. Location
 2. Wellness facilities (yes, the gym matters)
 3. Room size and vibe

And I’m not alone. Wellness is no longer a trend-it’s a lifestyle, and for many, a non negotiable. Guests want to know what they’re walking into. Yet most hotel content skips the gym entirely. We’ll see 25 angles of a croissant and 14 shots of an empty ballroom before we see a single decent image of the fitness space if we see one at all.

From a content and commercial standpoint, this is a missed opportunity. And dare I say, a revenue leak. Because I know I’ve skipped so many bookings due to the lack of gym visibility. And I know others who have, too.

It doesn’t take much. A quick reel of someone mid workout, a carousel showing off your recovery zone, even a highlight tour of the space. Bonus points if you actually tell us who it’s for: jet lagged execs, spin addicts, gym rats, or just parents escaping the breakfast buffet chaos.

We’ve spent years reimagining hospitality around experiences, lifestyle, and personalization. And yet, in 2025, the gym is still treated like an afterthought. Maybe it’s time we moved it closer to the front.

Because let’s be honest, that same old croissant isn’t booking the room. But a gym that makes me want to train? That just might.

We want to work out every day. Just like we want to eat. Sleep. Breathe. 

So please, show us the gym.

posts.content:
There are moments as a parent that just hit differently, and watching my 11-year-old daughter recently embark on her very first entrepreneurial adventure was definitely one of those proud moments worth sharing. Seeing her navigate the process – from ideation to execution – filled me with an overwhelming sense of pride and immense hope for the next generation of leaders.

As a woman leader in marketing, I've always championed innovation and strategic thinking, and believed in the power of initiative. To see those seeds blossom in my own girl at such a young age, and to witness her enthusiasm and learning, is truly rewarding and inspiring at the same time.

What started as a passion project for beaded jewelry at home, led her to exhibit at a community market last year. This was followed by an incredible offer to collaborate for a limited edition collection by a woman-led (thanks a mil Eisha Ramrakhiani! ❤️) home-grown online jewelry brand - E3K, earlier this year.
In case you're in the mood for some retail therapy, you can find a link to her collection that just dropped - E3K x Jannat here: [https://e3k.shop/]

Did it add work for us as parents? Yes, of course! But given both our marketing backgrounds, we made her understand that brands are not built overnight, and you need to be committed to the cause. From picking the name of her brand, to designing the logo, deciding the platforms to be present on, and crafting her brand story – she was part of it all and led with heart.
The best part was showing her how to run a business or shall I say 'show me the money'! Thankfully, she was quick to grasp that it doesn’t all go back into the piggy bank. Instead, the '3 F’s' of budgeting would apply to how she manages her income:
- Fundamentals
- Fun
- Future self

It's a powerful reminder that the lessons we learn, and the opportunities we create, can truly shape incredible futures. Feeling extremely grateful and inspired today.

(Jai Tolani)

posts.content:
This Sunday, I watched India beat Pakistan by 7 wickets in the Asia Cup.

Pakistan managed 127/9. India chased it down with 131/3.

But what stayed with me wasn’t the scorecard.

It was watching Kuldeep Yadav tear through Pakistan’s batting lineup - 3 wickets for just 18 runs. This guy had been waiting for his moment, and when it came, he grabbed it.

There’s something about watching athletes trust their instincts under pressure that gets to me. 
That split second when all the practice meets the defining moment and you either rise or you don’t.

Suryakumar Yadav finished unbeaten on 47. Abhishek Sharma contributed 31. Neither had perfect conditions. Neither waited for the “right” moment.

They just played their game when it mattered.

Reminds me why I sometimes make my best calls at work when I stop overthinking and just go with what feels right.

Some of our biggest wins have come from trusting ourselves rather than waiting for perfect data.

Anyway, hell of a match. Sometimes the scoreboard doesn’t tell the real story.

What did you think of Kuldeep’s performance? The guy was on fire.

posts.content:
If wealth had a passport, it would say: UAE.



Why are global companies obsessed with Dubai?

Well, for starters, it gives access to two billion people in one region. Companies aren't just entering Dubai; they're using it to conquer entire regions, like the Middle East, Africa, South Asia, and even parts of Europe.

That’s the Dubai formula.

When people say “Dubai connects East and West,” I used to think it was just marketing.

Until I realized:

> You can reach 2 billion people within 4 hours of flying from Dubai (that’s one third of the world.) That’s breakfast in Dubai, meetings in Nairobi, and dinner in Mumbai.

> You don't have to pay income tax, capital gains tax, or inheritance tax.

> Top-tier infrastructure: 2 world class airports + Jebel Ali Port

> Zero red tape: duty-free zones, 100% foreign ownership in many sectors

> Massive talent pool: cross-border hiring made easy

> Access to 3 billion+ consumers across emerging and mature markets

Entering Dubai is not entering only one market; it's stepping into a region. Dubai not only gives people ease of doing business but also speed.

No wonder companies set up here to scale faster: logistics are tighter, regulations are cleaner, and your markets are literally hours away.

And once you see it that way, it's hard to unsee.

Do you run a business in Dubai?

posts.content:
A German psychologist spent years memorizing nonsense syllables.


His self-experiment in 1885 revealed something shocking about human memory.

The results explain why most training programs fail - and how to fix them:

The experiment: Hermann Ebbinghaus tested his own memory using meaningless combinations of letters.

He memorized lists, then tested himself at different intervals. What he discovered changed our understanding of learning forever. 

The brutal truth: Within an hour of learning new information people tend to forget up to 50% of it. Within 24 hours, this can increase to 70% .

Within a week, they forget up to 90% of what they "learned". Your brain literally dumps most new information within hours.

Why this happens: Your brain is constantly filtering what's "worth keeping."

Unless information gets reinforced, it assumes it's not important.

The sharpest decline in retention occurs within the first twenty minutes and is significant within the first hour.

Here's the simple technique that changes everything:

Spaced repetition.
Instead of cramming once, you review at strategic intervals:
- Review #1: Within 24 hours
- Review #2: After 3 days
- Review #3: After 1 week
- Review #4: After 1 month
Instead of trying to cram all the information in at once, repeat the learning multiple times after the initial lesson. This strategy helps to increase memory retention.

Each review "resets" the forgetting curve, making memories stronger and longer-lasting.

Why most training fails: Companies spend millions on one-time workshops, then wonder why nothing sticks.

Employees forget 90% within a week because there's no follow-up.

How I apply this: 
→ Set calendar reminders to review key concepts 1 day, 3 days, and 1 week after learning 
→ Use spaced repetition apps like Anki for important information
→ Break training into smaller chunks with built-in review cycles 
→ Take notes, then revisit them at increasing intervals

The difference between forgetting and mastering isn't talent. It's timing.

What's one skill you learned but lost because you didn't review it?

posts.content:
Leaders, ignore these signs at your own risk

7 signs the worst parts of your culture are getting louder:

1. Poor Communication
- Lack of transparency from management.
- Infrequent or unclear updates on company goals.
- Limited opportunities for employee feedback.

2. High Turnover Rates
- Frequent resignations or layoffs.
- Difficulty retaining top talent.
- Constantly hiring to fill the same positions.

3. Unmanageable Workloads
- Employees frequently working overtime.
- Unrealistic deadlines and expectations.
- Lack of resources and support.

4. Office Politics
- Favoritism and nepotism.
- Undermining and backstabbing among colleagues.
- Decisions based on personal relationships, not merit.

5. Lack of Recognition
- Employees' achievements go unnoticed.
- Infrequent or nonexistent praise from management.
- No reward system for exceptional performance.

6. Low Morale
- Widespread employee dissatisfaction.
- High levels of stress and burnout.
- Lack of enthusiasm and engagement.

7. Poor Work-Life Balance
- Expectations to be available outside of work hours.
- Limited flexibility for personal time.
- No support for mental health and well-being.

Heed these warning signs.
Listen to your employees.

Go back to your core values.
Remove toxic people.

Gather strong leaders.
Provide psychological safety.

Rebuild a safe and thriving environment.

A healthy culture drives healthy profits.

Agree?

posts.content:
𝗕𝘂𝘆, 𝗟𝗲𝗮𝘀𝗲, 𝗼𝗿 𝗪𝗮𝗶𝘁?

Yesterday’s poll revealed something clear:
leaders are split on how to play Dubai’s office cycle:

𝗕𝘂𝘆 → voters want capital growth & long-term security.
𝗟𝗲𝗮𝘀𝗲 → supporters prioritize flexibility & cashflow.
𝗛𝘆𝗯𝗿𝗶𝗱 → thinkers see sense in owning a core HQ while leasing for scale.
And some prefer to 𝘄𝗮𝗶𝘁 & 𝗼𝗯𝘀𝗲𝗿𝘃𝗲, reading the cycle cautiously.

The reality? There isn’t one perfect model — it depends on where you are in your business journey. What’s clear is companies aren’t just chasing space; they’re seeking 𝗲𝗰𝗼𝘀𝘆𝘀𝘁𝗲𝗺𝘀 𝘁𝗵𝗮𝘁 𝗮𝗹𝗶𝗴𝗻 𝘄𝗶𝘁𝗵 𝘀𝘁𝗿𝗮𝘁𝗲𝗴𝘆.

That’s why the conversation around 𝗗𝗔𝗠𝗔𝗖 𝗗𝗶𝘀𝘁𝗿𝗶𝗰𝘁 𝗼𝗳𝗳𝗶𝗰𝗲𝘀 is timely.

In a market that has already seen 2,682 office sales YTD at an average of AED 1,746 psf, and156K lease contracts worth AED 6.7B, demand is clearly strong across both ownership and leasing.

With 𝗗𝗔𝗠𝗔𝗖 𝗗𝗶𝘀𝘁𝗿𝗶𝗰𝘁, businesses gain a rare mix:

• Security for owners
• Flexibility for tenants
• Scalability for hybrids

It’s not just real estate — 𝗶𝘁’𝘀 𝗮 𝗽𝗹𝗮𝘁𝗳𝗼𝗿𝗺 𝗳𝗼𝗿 𝗴𝗿𝗼𝘄𝘁𝗵.

Edgnex Data Centers by DAMAC is now officially DAMAC Digital.​

posts.content:
“Can you give me a 12-page report on this?”

Of course.

Open ChatGPT, Copilot, whatever. Tap in a few prompts. Boom. Twelve glorious pages of well-formatted, confidence drenched waffle.

Three charts. A quote from McKinsey. Something that looks suspiciously like insight but could also be AI generated filler.

Done.

Five minutes later?

Your manager hops onto ChatGPT.

“Can you summarise this for me?”

Naturally.

Open ChatGPT again. “Summarise this.” Output: three bullet points and a vague recommendation about alignment.

This, ladies and gentlemen, is the modern workplace.

AI isn’t destroying jobs. It’s just exposing how much of what we do never needed doing in the first place.

The meetings that could’ve been emails. 

The emails that could’ve been nothing. 

The slide decks with 74 animations to say: “Sales are fine.”

AI didn’t create the fluff.

It just made it obvious.

We’ve built entire careers around making things look impressive instead of making them useful.

Now we have a tool that says, “You want to pretend? I can pretend faster.”

And suddenly, everyone’s nervous.

Because when your whole value is formatting busywork into bullet points, AI isn’t competition.

It’s a spotlight.

And for some?

It’s the first time their job description has been seen in full daylight. Only to realise it’s mostly smoke.

♻️ Repost this if you’ve ever read a report and wondered, “Why does this exist?”

Or just follow Edward Frank Morris for more AI insights, sarcasm, and the occasional professional AI woe.

posts.content:
🎯 الصراع من زاوية مختلفة: قطر بين الوساطة والضغط
عند قراءة المشهد الأخير، يمكن النظر إلى الضربة الإسرائيلية في قطر كجزء من معركة أوسع تتجاوز حدود غزة.
 الهدف الاستراتيجي لإسرائيل منذ بداية الحرب كان تهجير الفلسطينيين خارج القطاع، وتحديدًا إلى سيناء، بما يضمن تفريغه وتهيئته للاحتلال الكامل، وتحويله إلى مركز إقليمي يخدم المخطط الأمريكي في تفتيت وحدة الدول العربية.
لكن العقبة الكبرى كانت الموقف المصري الرافض لضغوط التهجير. لذلك، كان من بين السيناريوهات المطروحة محاولة إخراج قطر من دور الوسيط، بحيث تُترك مصر وحدها في الواجهة، فتتحمل مسؤولية فشل المفاوضات أمام العالم، وتُدفع في النهاية للقبول بالحل المفروض.
الضربة الإسرائيلية وما تبعها من تصعيد سياسي متوقّع من جانب قطر كان الهدف منها دفع الدوحة إلى التخلي عن دور الوسيط، وهو المطلوب إسرائيليًا. غير أن الرد المصري من قلب الدوحة، حين استخدم الرئيس المصري تعبير "العدو" في وصف إسرائيل، أعطى انطباعًا ضمنيًا بوجود قبول قطري للدور المصري وتنسيق بين الطرفين في مواجهة إسرائيل. كما أن التسريبات حول فكرة تشكيل قوة عربية موحّدة وما قد يترتب عليها من تبعات على المدى الطويل، مثل تقليص الاعتماد على الحماية الأمريكية، دفعت واشنطن إلى اتخاذ خطوة معاكسة. فجاء تصريح وزير الخارجية الأمريكي مؤكدًا أن قطر هي الوسيط الوحيد، وكأنه اعتراف بفشل محاولة تحييد الدوحة من المشهد، وهو ما يصب في مصلحة مصر التي ترغب بوجود أكثر من وسيط لضمان عدم مواجهتها الضغوط منفردة.
كما يمكن ملاحظة الدعم العسكري المصري للأردن أيضًا، في محاولة لتعزيز الجبهة الأردنية التي تواجه ضغوطًا لا تقل خطورة عن تلك التي تتعرض لها مصر.
الخلاصة: ما حدث لم يكن مجرد تصفية لقادة، بل كان جولة جديدة من جولات الشطرنج السياسي، استخدمت فيها الأطراف أدواتها بمهارة، ليبقى الصراع على النفوذ في قلب المنطقة مفتوحًا.

posts.content:
Bravo to ADGM on the announcement that "14 Leading Financial Institutions, Representing Over $450billion Confirm Setup in Abu Dhabi in One Week".

As we are so often taught, in business, law and life, follow the money!

There are many reasons why corporate and individual wealth is fleeing traditional jurisdictions. The Swiss reState Foundation estimates that USD4trn of personal wealth is looking for a new home (that's about the same size as the German economy). 

Governments must react quickly to the threat that the most economically productive elements of society can and will move. They are no longer prisoners of geography. And many fine countries around the world welcome them with open arms, albeit sotto voce.

As the sense of malaise and disenfranchisement grows in many high-tax, liberal democracies, Governments need to roadmap an environment in which they are left with ever fewer net contributors and ever more net recipients. What will their solution be? To enhance the tax burden on those that are left? To build ever greater barriers to the outflow of talent and resources? To legislate and regulate ever more, as the need to control outweighs the need to collaborate? 

To say we live in interesting times is an understatement.

posts.content:
A Vision of Excellence in Luxury Real Estate : DAMAC Properties & Its Trailblazing Leaders!

DAMAC Properties stands as a testament to the boundless potential of visionary leadership and innovation. Since 1982, under the brilliant guidance of Hussain Sajwani 🌹, DAMAC has redefined luxury living, creating iconic real estate developments that have shaped cities worldwide. His unwavering commitment to excellence has led DAMAC to deliver over 46,000 homes and expand its presence across 15 cities, including Dubai, Riyadh, London, and Miami.

The company's collaboration with world-renowned lifestyle brands like Versace, Fendi, and Roberto Cavalli speaks volumes about its ambition to offer residents not just homes, but masterpieces of design and elegance.


At the heart of this transformation is Ali Hussain Sajwani 🌹 , who has masterfully blended technology with luxury through groundbreaking projects such as the Mandarin Oriental Resort in the Maldives. His leadership is pivotal in driving DAMAC Properties's growth internationally, with a special focus on expanding the hospitality arm into global markets.

As a visionary entrepreneur, Ali Hussain Sajwani's creation of Amali Properties alongside his sister, Amira Sajwani 🌹, marks a bold new chapter in the luxury real estate landscape, with properties designed to offer a unique fusion of serenity, bespoke luxury, and architectural brilliance.


Amira Sajwani is an inspiring business leader and advocate for women in business, has played an integral role at DAMAC Properties, ensuring the highest standards of excellence in every project. With her leadership, PRYPCO has revolutionized real estate transactions, and her role as a judge on Shark Tank underscores her keen eye for disruptive innovation.


A true pioneer, Abbas Sajwani 🌹founder of AHS Properties, has emerged as a leading figure in the ultra-luxury property market. From founding his conglomerate at just 18 years old to creating bespoke mansions through AHS Properties, Abbas Sajwani has built a property portfolio worth over $1.2 billion USD, redefining opulence for the world’s elite.


With over 100 global awards, DAMAC Properties continues to set the standard for luxury and innovation in real estate. The Sajwani family's entrepreneurial spirit, commitment to diversity, and drive to elevate the industry remain an inspiration for all.

Let's celebrate their exceptional contributions and relentless pursuit of greatness in reshaping the future of luxury living. 

Hussain Sajwani Ali Hussain Sajwani Amira Sajwani Abbas Sajwani DAMAC Properties AHS Properties Amali Properties PRYPCO

posts.content:
Need for AI Tools that Enhance Human Intelligence.


In the near future, the unchecked and excessive use of AI tools and automated agents poses a growing threat to humanity. Though these technologies bring undeniable convenience and efficiency, over-reliance on them risks dulling the very qualities that define us as human — our ability to think critically, create, and solve problems. If we continue to delegate even the simplest of tasks to machines, we risk the slow erosion of human intellect, creativity, and the innate capacity to grow and adapt as individuals and as a society.

Promoting the development and use of AI tools that enhance human intelligence is one of the key remedies.

posts.content:
✨ Some of the best life lessons come from the most unexpected conversations.

🚇 A Conversation That Made Me Reflect
This morning on the metro, I met a lady who has been living in Dubai for over 15 years. For almost the same time, she has worked in a nursery in Dubai.
Recently, her husband’s job shifted to Abu Dhabi, and the family moved there. But every day, she still travels all the way from Abu Dhabi to Dubai for work. The long commute leaves her tired, and she admitted she isn’t comfortable with this new routine.
I gently suggested she explore job opportunities in Abu Dhabi. It would save her time, energy, and give her more balance in life.
Her response stayed with me:
 👉 “I’ve been in the same nursery for 15 years. I’m scared to move out of my comfort zone.”
It reminded me how often we all hold on to the familiar—even when it starts working against us. Change feels risky, but sometimes staying the same costs us much more.
Stepping out of our comfort zone isn’t easy. It takes courage. But it also creates space for growth, balance, and new opportunities we may not even imagine today.
That short metro conversation was a reminder for me too: comfort zones feel safe, but they can also keep us stuck.
✨ Sometimes, one brave step into the unknown can make life not only different—but better.
👉 Have you ever faced a moment where stepping out of your comfort zone changed your life for the better?

posts.content:
Thrilled to be at “Databricks Back From Summit Recap – Dubai” today!

Every time I work with Databricks I’m reminded how that speed-to-value and data-driven decisions become the norm, not the exception.

Fresh from the Databricks Data + AI Summit 2025, I am looking forward to super-charge that velocity with 

🔹 Lakebase – Postgres-compatible transactional engine that lives inside the Lakehouse. One platform for OLTP and analytics.

🔹 Databricks One – a clean, persona-driven UX for execs & frontline teams; insights without the notebooks.

🔹 Lakeflow GA & Lakeflow Designer – low-code ingestion + declarative pipelines + CDC in one place.

🔹 Unity Catalog Metrics & Attribute-Based Access Control (ABAC) – define KPIs once, enforce data policies dynamically across clouds.

🔹 Agent Bricks – declarative Gen-AI agents that auto-evaluate cost vs quality and get your RAG apps production-ready in days.

🔹 Databricks Apps – host Streamlit/FastAPI apps inside Databricks.

🔹 Delta Lake 4.0 Preview – multi-cloud transactions, Variant type, Spark Connect support; reliability meets openness.

And, a Free Edition now lets anyone spin up a full Lakehouse workspace for learning and PoCs.

⚡️ Can’t wait to unpack what these mean for MENA data teams — especially around governed GenAI and real-time operational analytics.

Thanks Amine Benhamza for the invite.

➡️ If you’re in today, let’s connect !

posts.content:
Most wellness businesses operate with quantity over quality. They flood the platform with any and every solution they can find. More listings. More noise. More mediocrity.

But AI lets us flip this model completely.

Instead of creating a massive directory, AI allows us to identify and amplify the best specialist and increase their impact by connecting them with the right people, and help them serve at scale—without losing depth or quality.

This doesn’t just improve access—it widens the gap between an outstanding specialist and an average one.

Who are these outstanding specialists?

They are not just practitioners. They are custodians of knowledge.

- A generational Ayurvedic specialist, trained in formulations passed down for centuries
- A martial arts master, upholding the traditions of a 500-year-old school 
- A yoga teacher with 30+ years of mastery—beyond trends, beyond commercial studios 
- A Vedic scholar with five decades of deep study, distilling wisdom modern science is only beginning to validate
- A music guru from an ancient gharana, carrying forward a lineage of Nada Yoga
- A specialist who has been using a thousand-year-old recipe to create therapeutic food

These people don’t just teach—they embody the practice.

But the problem with most marketplaces is that they treat expertise as a commodity. They optimize for more options, more surface-level engagement. And in doing so, they dilute real knowledge.

We need to do the opposite. 

A few outstanding specialists can now impact thousands if not millions—without losing depth. 

Personalization can scale—without becoming generic. 

Authenticity can remain the foundation—not an afterthought.

Because in lifestyle businesses, quality matters far more than quantity.

AI done right doesn’t dilute expertise—it elevates it.

We need a new way to access the rarest and most profound knowledge. 

Not from whoever shows up on a directory, but from those who have truly lived it.

posts.content:
First KCMinsey, and now YE.

How many of you remember the name of the person who ended his life due to overwork pressure at KCMinsey? And now, another tragic loss of an YE employee for the same reason.

Overwork and stress are silent killers in high-pressure environments, yet we seem to forget these tragedies too quickly. There’s a theory called the “72-hour rule,” which suggests that people tend to forget everything after 72 hours. Sadly, the brand ambassador of this theory seems to be our society. A few weeks ago, we lost a talented doctor, and guess what? People moved on.

No amount of money can ever compensate for the loss experienced by the parents of these young individuals.

We need to ask ourselves: when will this end? What can we do to ensure that no one else has to pay such a high price for their career? It’s time to create workplaces that value mental health and well-being over relentless productivity.

Let’s not forget. 

P.S: Inshort

posts.content:
I flew to the US a few months back and attended Justin Welsh's talk on LinkedIn growth. The man has grown to 770K followers in 5 years. I'm still at 290K in 4 years. Here's what I am doing wrong/right:

Let's talk about what I'm doing wrong first.

→ Value-add commenting - Justin uses the "CEA" formula (Compliment, Expand, Ask) on 5-10 posts daily with surgical precision. Meanwhile, I comment when something randomly catches my eye.

→ Micro-interviews - He actively reaches out to influencers with thoughtful, specific questions about their expertise, then shares their responses as posts (with permission). 

→ Trend translation - He has Google Alerts set up for industry keywords and is consistently first to explain what breaking news means for his specific niche. 

→ Early comment engagement - He replies to the first 6-8 comments within minutes of posting, which signals to LinkedIn's algorithm that his content is engaging and boosts reach. 

→ Systematic repurposing - He turns one piece of research or insight into 5-6 different posts: the main insight, a contrarian take, a personal story illustrating it, a how-to guide, a mistake to avoid, and a future prediction. 

→ Strategic collaborations - I used to create joint content, co-host discussions, and cross-promote with other creators in my space. But I've completely neglected this, missing out on audience overlap and compound growth opportunities.

What I'm doing right:

→ Posting consistently - I publish 4 times a week without fail. This consistency has built trust with my audience and kept me top-of-mind.
→ Killer hooks - I spend genuine time crafting that first line to stop the scroll. Keep the hooks <280 characters
→ Behind-the-scenes content - I share failures, mistakes, and real struggles without sugar-coating them. 
→ Contrarian takes - I'm not afraid to share unpopular opinions. 
→ Strategic giveaways - I regularly offer valuable downloadable resources that actually solve problems. 
→ Authentic storytelling - I write like I talk, sharing personal experiences that illustrate broader business principles. 

The biggest difference is that he's intentional about every single move.

I post consistently and create good content, but I haven’t been strategic enough with profile optimization, early comment engagement, or systematic repurposing.

Time to level up. Growth isn’t just about posting more. It’s about being smarter with how you use the platform.

posts.content:
Very insightful last of couple of weeks! I spoke at the Epicon Family Office Summit in Dubai about tokenization and its role in reshaping real-world asset strategies.

In real estate, tokenization is gaining significant traction. Dubai’s recent moves, including partnerships with Prypco and Crypto.com, are laying the groundwork for fractional ownership and new investor models in a regulated digital environment, opening up a rather illiquid asset class to a much broader range of investors. 

Just days later, in Berlin, I joined the national Cell & Gene Therapy Investor Day. The takeaway: AI is already accelerating discovery, which will push comprehensive prevention, longevity and personalized medicine from vision into reality.

In my day-to-day work and conversations with professional services firms, I increasingly see GenAI use cases gaining real traction, particularly in automating analysis, processing transactions and research. Much of what was once entry-level work is quietly being eliminated.

What connects all of this? Technology is disrupting how we invest, operate, and plan. And in contrast to past transformations we are seeing a speed of change which is 5-10x.

The implication for business leaders: These shifts aren’t theoretical. They are already reshaping career paths, operating models, and strategic priorities. A similar speed and agility of decision making and implementation is needed to keep pace with these technology and market changes.

posts.content:
Back in Dubai, I can reflect on last week’s meetings across Europe and during the TECH Europe Summit in Heilbronn. The visit revealed something I hadn’t seen in a while specifically in Germany: renewed optimism and a willingness to move beyond the status quo.
 
Some key takeaways:
 
🔹 Tech Sovereignty Demands Urgency and Talent
 
Europe’s digital and technological sovereignty is being diluted, by fragmented regulation (27 different legal regimes and diverging views on sovereignty) and protracted investment cycles. The US and China lead and to catch up will be a momentous task. But individual initiatives are gaining momentum and global talents are increasingly looking again at Europe to build their career. To continue that the environment incl. incentives, regulation and tax policies need to improve to be competitive. 
 
🔹 AI is everywhere and finance has to lead 
 
We’re seeing a rapid shift from “death by a thousand POCs” to real-world enterprise deployments. The age of pilots is ending; scale is the new imperative with automation moving from tasks to processes. AI is now delivering tangible impact across core enterprise functions—including finance, where I’ve seen firsthand how automation and real-time insights are reshaping decision-making, compliance, risk management and resource allocation. 
 
🔹 Regulation vs. Innovation
 
Europe remains a global leader f.ex. in trusted, high-quality healthcare and pharma - but it’s losing ground. Meanwhile, AI is transforming the sector, from early-stage molecule screening to automating R&D workflows. For Europe to remain competitive, three enablers are critical: 
• Streamlined regulatory pathways 
• Access to anonymized patient data in accessible formats and structure 
• Sovereign AI deployed in trusted, compliant environments 
 
Will the current optimism have a lasting effect and lead European companies to invest more locally again and will needed policy changes be implemented quickly? One way to move forward swiftly is to look to the Middle East. 
 
The UAE and broader GCC are accelerating and emerging as a serious tech player, with unified leadership and fast policy execution. Its major investments and evolving policy framework in AI, blockchain (incl. tokenization of real estate) and data infrastructure could be a basis for a deeper partnership between Europe and the UAE. Combining Europe’s domain strength and regulatory credibility with the UAE’s agility and investment power can unlock sovereign, scalable, and secure innovation models.
 
Would welcome your thoughts on this.

posts.content:
The Day I Almost Designed My Way Into Exile 😂

Every creative person has that one career moment where they desperately wish for a Ctrl+Z. Mine? Oh, it was historic—literally.

Picture this: 
a proud day, welcoming the king of a country. I was tasked with designing his official greeting. The photo was perfect, his smile radiated, and everything was falling into place… except for one thing. I thought, “Hey, let’s get creative! Let’s flip the image so he’s looking into the frame.” Genius, right? I mean, how could anything possibly go wrong?

Well, let me tell you: everything went wrong.

In my brilliance, I flipped the image. But here’s the kicker—flipping it also switched the king’s raised hand from his right to his left. Yup, I accidentally had the king of a country waving to his people with the wrong hand. And as fate would have it, the design was published in an official newspaper. To the entire country.

The reaction? Let’s just say the fallout wasn’t subtle. The whole newspaper was shut down for a while. I was ready to pack my bags and move to a remote island where no one could find me. All this because I wanted my design to look “balanced.”

I learned two things that day:
 1. Never underestimate the power of a flipped image.
 2. Never overestimate the power of “it’ll probably be fine.”

Have you ever made a career mistake so big it could’ve made headlines? Let’s hear your “Ctrl+Z moments” and laugh together (or cry—it’s fine).

posts.content:
We all hear it constantly: “Think outside the box!” But lately, I have a feeling no one’s in the box anymore – it’s completely empty! We’ve gotten so comfortable breaking the rules that the box itself seems to have lost its value. It’s almost as if the creative world is in a competition to see who can go the furthest from reason and logic.

Don’t get me wrong, I love crazy ideas – the wilder, the better! But there’s a difference between pushing the boundaries and throwing the map out the window. Real creativity, the kind that makes an impact, isn’t just about “breaking the rules” – it’s about knowing which rules to break and why.

And sometimes, I wonder what those big brand presentations look like. Like, imagine being in the room when someone pitched Xiaomi’s new logo: “It’s not a circle. It’s not a square. It’s… kind of round-ish!” Or when someone decided Jaguar’s fierce logo needed to go from wild predator to friendly Barbie cat. And yet, the deal was signed, sealed, and delivered for astronomical numbers. I can just picture the client’s face, nodding seriously while thinking, “Yes, yes… this semi-circle is definitely worth a few million!” 😂

Maybe it’s time we look inside the box again. Not to play it safe, but to rediscover meaning, purpose, and ideas that don’t just scream for attention but actually make sense. I’m all for being bold and rebellious, but if everything is “outside the box,” maybe the most radical move is to look back inside it – and find something worth saying.

posts.content:
I’ll never forget the first time I saw someone working in Photoshop. I was absolutely mesmerized – sitting there with my mouth wide open, watching the magic unfold on screen. It was like watching someone transform reality right in front of my eyes, with just a few clicks, layers, and creative instincts.

From that moment, I was hooked. I knew this was what I wanted to do. I dove headfirst into the world of creative design, determined to learn everything I could – every tool, every technique, every trick that could bring my ideas to life.

Design isn’t just a skill; it’s a passion that drives me every day. Whether it’s crafting a brand, building a visual story, or exploring the newest technology, I’m always chasing that feeling I had during my first encounter with Photoshop. It’s about pushing boundaries, mastering the craft, and discovering what’s possible.

I’ve always loved the saying, “Work what you love, and you’ll never work a day in your life.” For me, creative design is that kind of work – the kind that feels more like play, more like passion, and never like a chore.

But let’s be real – it’s also a hardcore job. 
Late nights, endless revisions, and coffee-fueled sprints are all part of the magic. So yes, I love it… but I’ve definitely worked a few hundred days in my life! 😂

posts.content:
In today’s world, leadership often feels like balancing on shifting ground. Global pressures, financial trade-offs and team dynamics can pull leaders in many directions at once.
 
The pace is fast, the pressures are immense and it can be hard to pause, reflect and notice the potential already inside you.
 
I have lived this myself. Sometimes growth came in a crisis. Other times because a leader or coach helped me see strengths I hadn’t noticed.
 
I see coaching as the ‘epigenetics switch’ of leadership. Just as DNA holds vast potential but much of it stays dormant waiting for the right signal, each of us carries unexpressed strengths and wisdom. Coaching creates the conditions for those hidden capacities to awaken.
 
That is why I am beginning this next chapter as a coach. Alongside my transformation and consulting work, coaching is a natural complement. It deepens how I support leaders not just with strategies but with the inner clarity to carry them forward.
 
Through coaching, I am looking to create rare safe space where leaders feel seen, be authentic and unlock what is hidden in the noise of daily work. 

My endeavour is to 
 1. create awareness that open new perspectives
 2. help make tough choices easier to see and act on 
 3. support small, practical steps that build trust in one’s own capacity
 
When leaders reconnect with their essence, they inspire ripple effects that strengthen teams, organizations and society. 

So here is your invitation, if you or your team are exploring a new way forward, I would welcome a conversation.
 

I am grateful to those who invested in my International Coaching Federation journey with Erickson Coaching International specially my guru Gaurav Arora, MCC (ICF) and my accountability partners. Your support made this step possible. 


ASIT KUMAR, GTML™ Sonal Malhotra Anupama Chandna Swaty Kumar Sunaina Banga Kakoli Dutta Priya Prasad Mohit Jaggi MAYA MEMBI Michael R Fernandes Preeti Verma, PCC (ICF) 🕉 Devanshu Gour Dilpreeta Vasudeva Latha Girish and more.

posts.content:
Most executive teams do not struggle because they miss to detect a problem , they struggle because they use wrong approach. 

At scale, challenges usually falls into 2 bucket:
1. Complicated problems : technical, difficult but solvable.
2. Complex problems : human, messy, adaptive and ongoing.

The trap? Leaders often treat complex issues (like trust, culture, alignment) as if they can be “fixed” with a tool, a framework or a re-org. That is why new processes seems to work for a while then old chaos return.

Here is the shift - 
1. Complicated problems need expertise and answers. 
2. Complex ones need leaders to create the rhythm that lets teams thrive.

posts.content:
AI in Art: Innovation or Imitation? What do you think?

Can a machine create… or is it simply copying with flair?

From generating surreal paintings to composing music and designing logos, AI is elbowing its way into the creative world.

But here's the million-dollar question:

 Is AI truly creative, or is it just remixing what humans have already made?
 - Artists are divided.
 - Techies are excited.
 - Collectors are curious.
 
And the rest of us? We're watching this new canvas unfold, one pixel at a time.
Can algorithms feel inspiration?
Can creativity be coded?
Or are we just redefining what art means in the age of AI?

Lets Debate: Is AI empowering artists, replacing them, or redefining creativity altogether?

posts.content:
EDGNEX, Data Centers by DAMAC, is proud to announce our second major investment in Thailand’s digital infrastructure, committing over 32 billion Baht (1 billion USD) to a series of data center projects to meet the growing demands of AI technology.

In the esteemed presence of His Excellency the Deputy Prime Minister of Thailand, EDGNEX entered a joint venture with ProEN Corp Public Company Limited, a leading player in Thailand’s tech sector. This historic partnership includes a state-of-the-art data center project with a total potential capacity of 20 MW. EDGNEX will hold a 70% stake in the JV and take responsibility for data center operations. This partnership strengthens EDGNEX’s presence in Thailand and reflects our commitment to advancing digital transformation across the APAC region.

Hussain Sajwani, Founder & Chairman of DAMAC Group, said: 'We are excited to expand our investment further into SEA and specifically into Thailand, a country that has shown immense potential for growth in digital innovation and smart technologies. We aim to support Thailand’s growing digital economy and provide the necessary infrastructure for the next generation of AI-driven businesses. With this announcement, we substantially commit to the Thailand market, outlining a pipeline of approximately 100 MW of future data center capacity."

For more information:
https://lnkd.in/dHWye_Pq

posts.content:
𝗜 𝗿𝗲𝗮𝗹𝗶𝘇𝗲𝗱 𝘄𝗲’𝗿𝗲 𝗯𝘂𝗶𝗹𝗱𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗔𝗜 𝗹𝗶𝗸𝗲 𝘄𝗲 𝗯𝘂𝗶𝗹𝗱 𝗿𝗲𝗹𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻𝘀𝗵𝗶𝗽𝘀—𝗼𝗻 𝗲𝗮𝗿𝗻𝗲𝗱, 𝗻𝗼𝘁 𝗯𝗹𝗶𝗻𝗱, 𝘁𝗿𝘂𝘀𝘁.

Last week, at an industry forum, a CIO of a large infrastructure company shared: 'We say our 
hashtag
#AI-powered sales prediction is 85% accurate. But we miss asking, "85% accurate at what? Predicting the past or predicting your future?"

Most AI demos follow the same script. Show impressive accuracy numbers. Promise efficiency gains. Present quick timelines. But it rarely shows how these claims were tested.

Here's what I've learned about testing AI:

Business Metrics are important. "Hours saved", "FTE re-calibration", "costs saved", "revenue increase". Also, define the decision and the cost of being wrong (false positives vs false negatives)

Equally important question: Is your AI making the right decisions when it matters? And how do you know?

𝗙𝗶𝗿𝘀𝘁, check what's missing. Seasonal changes, competitor actions, market shifts, local events (Ramadan/Diwali), VAT or policy changes, promotions. Run data-leakage checks to avoid biased attribution.

𝗦𝗲𝗰𝗼𝗻𝗱, test the method, not just the math. Validate problem framing, target definition, feature engineering and constraints. The smartest algorithm is useless if it's solving the wrong problem.

𝗧𝗵𝗶𝗿𝗱, test on real-world, out-of-time data. If your AI only works on training data, it's not intelligence-it's memorization. Use holdout tests and rolling back tests. And optimize expected value, not generic accuracy.

𝗙𝗼𝘂𝗿𝘁𝗵, test different scenarios. What works in 
hashtag
#Dubai might fail in London. What works in Q1 might break in Q4. Include shocks (supply disruptions), demand spikes (holiday seasons), and channel shifts.

𝗙𝗶𝗳𝘁𝗵, establish governance & human-in-the-loop. Define approval points, model explanations, and escalation paths for high-risk decisions.

𝗦𝗶𝘅𝘁𝗵, monitor constantly. Watch for data changes and business shifts. Retrain regularly and document updates as conditions change to minimise data and concept drifts.

The Russian saying 'Trust, but verify' was made famous by President Reagan. In the AI age, this isn't just good advice. It's survival.

Every algorithm will touch your revenue, reputation, and competitive position for years. As we are RTD AI models, you could ask validation questions like these:

For marketing attribution: Show me how this model performed when we paused Google Ads for a month.

For sales forecasting: What happens to accuracy when we remove our top-performing rep's data?

For pricing algorithms: How does this model handle flash sales vs. regular discount periods?

For investment recommendations: What's our override protocol when the model suggests 20% below market rate?

For customer churn prediction: Show me the false positive rate—how many 'loyal' customers did we unnecessarily discount?

Preparing 
hashtag
#AI for 
hashtag
#DigitalTransformation? - Trust by Authority → Trust by Process → Trust by Verification.

posts.content:
Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff calls it the '$3-12 trillion digital labour revolution' where AI handles customer servicing, selling, and marketing.

The goal is agentic personalization. AI systems that autonomously orchestrate customer experiences across all touchpoints.

As I am building personalization engines, what I've learnt is,
𝘁𝗲𝗰𝗵𝗻𝗼𝗹𝗼𝗴𝘆 𝗱𝗲𝗽𝗹𝗼𝘆𝗺𝗲𝗻𝘁 ≠ 𝗶𝗻𝗳𝗿𝗮𝘀𝘁𝗿𝘂𝗰𝘁𝘂𝗿𝗲 𝗿𝗲𝗮𝗱𝗶𝗻𝗲𝘀𝘀.

Building scalable personalization means bridging AI pilots and enterprise systems.

The infrastructure sequence that delivers results looks like this: 𝗗𝗮𝘁𝗮, 𝗗𝗲𝗰𝗶𝘀𝗶𝗼𝗻, 𝗗𝗲𝘀𝗶𝗴𝗻, 𝗗𝗶𝘀𝘁𝗿𝗶𝗯𝘂𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻, 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗗𝗲𝗰𝗶𝘀𝗶𝗼𝗻𝗶𝗻𝗴

The Foundation Layer (Build First):
Whether tracking property viewing patterns or mortgage inquiries, the foundation must include:

𝗔𝗜-𝗿𝗲𝗮𝗱𝘆 𝗗𝗮𝘁𝗮 𝗜𝗻𝗳𝗿𝗮𝘀𝘁𝗿𝘂𝗰𝘁𝘂𝗿𝗲 connects your data system, transactions, customer platforms (CDP), and analytics tools.
• Promotion engine (history of offers and redemption) – conversion intelligence
• Content engine (content history, engagement, metadata & taxonomy) – engagement optimization

𝗗𝗲𝗰𝗶𝘀𝗶𝗼𝗻𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗘𝗻𝗴𝗶𝗻𝗲𝘀 turn data into action. They predict which prospects will respond to rate promotions or property showcases. Three models:
• Promo propensity - predicting purchase likelihood
• Promo uplift - ROI between promotion vs. no-promotion 
• Content propensity and effectiveness – eliminate non-performing content

The Activation Layer (Scale After Foundation):
Picture this: within an hour of promotion approval, can your system launch personalized mortgage campaigns across property portals, broker networks, and prospect touchpoints?

𝗗𝗲𝘀𝗶𝗴𝗻 𝗦𝘆𝘀𝘁𝗲𝗺𝘀 must connect upstream data with downstream execution.
• Workflow Orchestration manages offers and AI content across campaigns
• Integrated Order Management Systems (catalogue, tag, distribute, redeem) delivering automation at enterprise scale

But models and creatives without distribution are just expensive spreadsheets.
𝗗𝗶𝘀𝘁𝗿𝗶𝗯𝘂𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻 𝗔𝗿𝗰𝗵𝗶𝘁𝗲𝗰𝘁𝘂𝗿𝗲 must process signals instantly, enabling real-time personalization
• Customer signal processing through journey orchestration and optimizing messaging
• Integration across multivendor advertising systems for a consistent brand experience

𝗦𝗲𝗹𝗳-𝗦𝗲𝗿𝘃𝗶𝗰𝗲 𝗗𝗮𝘀𝗵𝗯𝗼𝗮𝗿𝗱𝘀 closes the loop through centralized reporting - executives track revenue impact while operators optimize campaigns. 

The sequence matters more than the technology. 

Build your data foundation first. Get your decision engines humming. Layer on creative systems and distribution networks only after the foundation is solid. Skip steps, and you'll join the 65-70% still waiting for ROI.

posts.content:
Signing off with Gratitude - Sweet 16!!

When you have spent more than a 3rd of your life in an organization, then it doesn’t just remain a workplace, it becomes so intertwined and inseparable, that family, friends, work, life all become these overlapping brushstrokes on this beautiful canvas of space & time. On 22-Jan-2024 as I wrapped up my 
hashtag
#kpmgindia innings, it had been a complete 16 years; no, they somehow didn't feel or appear that long to me. A wonderful 7 in Mumbai & then even more fulfilling 9 in NCR Delhi, with so many more cities in India and the globe covered. The years have flown by so fast and in that period we together created a business, which to me and to many I know is also a feeling. A feeling that represents so many things, so many emotions – passion, purpose, warmth, belief, trust and belonging.
 
What we hold individually and as a team, as a professional and personal relationship, far outweighs any other aspect. The sincerity, commitment & desire to excel in everything we do at KPMG, as we solve our client’s business challenges, has been the bedrock of a meaningful work environment. Each and every one from our teams, our clients and all the internal functions is what makes it really happen. I will forever be indebted & grateful to each and every one of you. It is your trust and friendship, that I owe my successes to. Must also acknowledge those who had moved on earlier & made a big impact. I have equally well enjoyed the falls, the disagreements and at times some uncomfortable moments
– truly cherish them all. Please do pardon me for my missteps or when I may
have not lived up to your expectations, you can meet me separately for a drink or more, will be on me.
 
It's the lives we touch and the little parts of it that forever become embedded in our individual and collective story. 
 
A big heartfelt thank you to the firm’s leadership over these years, your belief and trust that you showed in me allowed me to take up different roles, newer challenges and give it my best. To all my colleagues and teams, from all service lines and functions in the firm, and most importantly to the MPAers spanning right from the day I joined on 21-Jan-2008 in Mumbai in the City Studio office. 

Respect and Gratitude!!!

Richard Rekhy Yezdi Nagporewalla Vinodkumar R. As I set sail for my next innings, I know in my heart that we still remain connected and our bond will stand me in good stead, for the next chapter. Thank you to my extended family and friends for life, thank you KPMG.

posts.content:
𝗜 𝗱𝗼𝗻’𝘁 𝗳𝗹𝘆 𝗯𝘂𝘀𝗶𝗻𝗲𝘀𝘀 𝗰𝗹𝗮𝘀𝘀.
Not because I don’t want to — I just can’t afford it.

So I wait.
Like many do.
Until my boarding zone is called.

Because in most systems, 𝗺𝗼𝗻𝗲𝘆 𝘀𝗽𝗲𝗮𝗸𝘀 𝗳𝗶𝗿𝘀𝘁.

But Dubai just flipped that script — in a way that hits home.
Literally.

The 𝗗𝘂𝗯𝗮𝗶 𝗟𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗗𝗲𝗽𝗮𝗿𝘁𝗺𝗲𝗻𝘁 has launched a programme that finally gives first-time homebuyers — expatriates and citizens who’ve dreamed of owning a home here — a front row seat.

This isn’t about wealth.
 
It’s about 𝗿𝗲𝗰𝗼𝗴𝗻𝗶𝘇𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗾𝘂𝗶𝗲𝘁 𝗮𝗺𝗯𝗶𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻 of people who’ve built their lives here, contributed to this city, raised families, worked hard...

And still wondered:

“𝘞𝘪𝘭𝘭 𝘐 𝘦𝘷𝘦𝘳 𝘰𝘸𝘯 𝘴𝘰𝘮𝘦𝘵𝘩𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘪𝘯 𝘵𝘩𝘪𝘴 𝘱𝘭𝘢𝘤𝘦 𝘐 𝘯𝘰𝘸 𝘤𝘢𝘭𝘭 𝘩𝘰𝘮𝘦?”

Now, the answer can be 𝘆𝗲𝘀.

Here’s what’s on the table:

🚪 𝗣𝗿𝗶𝗼𝗿𝗶𝘁𝘆 𝗮𝗰𝗰𝗲𝘀𝘀 to brand new property launches

💸 𝗗𝗶𝘀𝗰𝗼𝘂𝗻𝘁𝗲𝗱 𝗽𝗿𝗶𝗰𝗲𝘀, exclusive to first-time buyers

🧾 𝗗𝗟𝗗 𝗳𝗲𝗲𝘀 𝗶𝗻 𝗶𝗻𝘁𝗲𝗿𝗲𝘀𝘁-𝗳𝗿𝗲𝗲 𝗶𝗻𝘀𝘁𝗮𝗹𝗹𝗺𝗲𝗻𝘁𝘀

🏦 𝗖𝗼𝗺𝗽𝗲𝘁𝗶𝘁𝗶𝘃𝗲 𝗺𝗼𝗿𝘁𝗴𝗮𝗴𝗲 𝗽𝗹𝗮𝗻𝘀 from trusted banks

🤝 𝗣𝗮𝘆𝗺𝗲𝗻𝘁 𝗳𝗹𝗲𝘅𝗶𝗯𝗶𝗹𝗶𝘁𝘆 that makes it possible

And the 𝘪𝘮𝘱𝘢𝘤𝘵?

🏠 74% of all new homeowners in 2024 were first-timers

🔁 30% bought after rent hikes or eviction

👤 The 𝗮𝘃𝗲𝗿𝗮𝗴𝗲 𝗯𝘂𝘆𝗲𝗿 𝗶𝘀 𝗷𝘂𝘀𝘁 32

💪 A 15% 𝗿𝗶𝘀𝗲 𝗶𝗻 𝘀𝗼𝗹𝗼 𝗯𝘂𝘆𝗲𝗿𝘀 — people anchoring their future here on their own

This isn’t just a real estate policy.
It’s a quiet but powerful act of inclusion.

For many of us, 𝗗𝘂𝗯𝗮𝗶 𝗵𝗮𝘀 𝗮𝗹𝘄𝗮𝘆𝘀 𝗯𝗲𝗲𝗻 𝗮 𝗽𝗹𝗮𝗰𝗲 𝘄𝗲 𝗹𝗶𝘃𝗲.
Now, for the first time, it might become the place we 𝘁𝗿𝘂𝗹𝘆 𝗯𝗲𝗹𝗼𝗻𝗴.

posts.content:
When we talk about AI or LLMs, it often sounds like one giant category. But not all models are built the same and more importantly, not all are meant to solve the same problems.

The future of AI is not just about bigger models, but about choosing the right type of model for the right context.

Here is one way to classify LLMs:

⸻

1. Generalist LLMs

Broad, versatile models trained on massive datasets across domains. They are designed to handle almost anything: from drafting content to coding assistance, brainstorming, or customer support.

Examples: OpenAI GPT-4, Anthropic Claude, Google Gemini, Meta LLaMA.

⸻

2. Specialist LLMs

Fine-tuned for accuracy in a particular industry or vertical. These models understand compliance, jargon, and domain-specific challenges far better than generalists.

Examples: BloombergGPT (finance), Med-PaLM (healthcare)

⸻

3. Lightweight / Edge LLMs

Smaller and faster models optimized for efficiency. They are built for devices with limited compute, lower costs, or stricter privacy requirements—bringing AI closer to the edge.

Examples: Mistral 7B, LLaMA-2-7B, Phi-3, Google Gemma.

⸻

4. Reasoning LLMs

The new wave of models designed for structured, step-by-step logical reasoning. Instead of just predicting text, they “think” through problems making them better at planning, problem solving, and decision support.

Examples: DeepSeek-R1, OpenAI o1 models, K2 Think.

⸻

5. Agentic LLMs

The most advanced category—these don’t just respond, they act. By connecting to APIs, triggering workflows, and executing tasks autonomously, they behave like digital co-workers.

Examples: OpenAI GPTs (custom agents), AutoGPT, LangChain-powered agents.

⸻

Why This Matters

The real question is no longer “Which LLM is best?”
It is: “Which type of LLM is best for the problem I am solving?”

A mobile-first app may need a Lightweight model.
An innovation lab may explore Reasoning or Agentic LLMs to unlock new possibilities.

⸻

The takeaway:

We are moving from a world of “one-size-fits-all” AI to a future where LLMs are clustered, specialized, and chosen strategically.

If you had to pick one - would you start with a Generalist for broad coverage, or a Specialist for deep accuracy?

Growth is not always about speed.

In a world that celebrates fast results and quick wins, it’s easy to forget that the strongest foundations are often built slowly.

Sometimes growth looks like:
1. Slowing down long enough to reset.
2. Listening more than talking.
3. Choosing consistency over intensity.

Whether it’s teams, careers, or personal goals, the real breakthroughs often come from steady progress, not sudden leaps.

The quiet truth: Fast gets attention. Slow builds resilience.

What is one area in your work or life where slowing down actually helped you move further, faster?

posts.content:
Across industries, employees are adopting AI tools faster than companies can regulate them. From drafting reports to analyzing data, these tools offer instant productivity gains, but when used outside official channels, they create what we call Shadow AI.

The Risks:

1. Sensitive data exposed to unapproved platforms
2. Lack of oversight and accountability
3. Outputs inconsistent with business standards
4. Compliance and regulatory violations

The Opportunity

Shadow AI is proof of demand: people want AI to make work faster, smarter, and easier. Instead of blocking it, leaders should channel it.

The Path Forward:-
1. Provide company-approved AI platforms
2. Establish clear governance and usage policies
3. Educate teams on responsible adoption
4. Monitor usage to align AI with strategic goals

Shadow AI is not a threat it’s a signal. A signal that your workforce is ready to embrace AI today. The question is: Will organisations lead that adoption responsibly, or play catch up?

posts.content:
As the world gears up to celebrate International Women’s Day, it is imperative to recognize that true inclusion isn’t about making space for women—it’s about removing the barriers that shouldn’t exist in the first place and creating an ecosystem filled with empathy. 

The real game changer is not in grand policies but in micro-moments : who gets interrupted in meetings, whose ideas get credited, who gets the ‘soft work’ versus strategic roles. Gender equality isn’t about HR policies alone; it’s about everyday behaviors that all of us choose to challenge or reinforce.

Early in my career, I’ve seen brilliant women share ideas that were overlooked—only to gain traction when repeated by someone else. I made it a rule: always credit ideas to their originators. This small shift changes the dynamic, ensuring voices were heard based on merit. 

This IWD, let’s move beyond celebrations, greeting cards and gifts packs and commit to real change — one decision, one acknowledgment, one shift at a time.

#IWD25

posts.content:
Last week, I caught up with two few senior leaders – once clients, now good friends – discussing a quintessential transformation challenge. They poured millions into CRM, ERP, and automation, expecting efficiency and growth. Sadly, the results have been underwhelming thus far.

A deep dive revealed three structural challenges – 
(i) Tech without strategy – While the Gen AI hype is real, buying the latest tools without aligning them with business objectives and execution synergies proved to be a costly misstep 
(ii) People push back – High resistance and lack of proactivity as employees felt transformation was forced upon them rather than designed for them
(iii) Siloed systems – Finance, Sales, and Ops ran on disconnected platforms based on individual preferences rather than architectural coherence, leading to data chaos instead of clarity

We agreed the way forward needed to include the following to put the rocket-ship back on course:
✅ Pause and Reflect - Revisit the North Star, Operating Model, and Processes with the key principle that technology should fit the business needs, not the other way around
✅ Put People First – Make voices heard and provide a safe space for experimentation, innovation and dialogue. Disagreements if addressed right, create transformation evangelists who will champion the cause
✅ Integrate for Impact – Create an enterprise wide system and data architecture enabled by a connected ecosystem (ERP + CRM + AI) to fuel real-time decision-making and business agility

FP&A must focus on 3 things:

FP&A must partner with the CFO and CEO to minimize risks.

At it's core, FP&A is about people and impact.

Not VLOOKUP or INDEX MATCH. 

Agree or disagree?

posts.content:
النهاردة خدنا أكبر خطوة في تاريخنا..

النهاردة بنقول لكل تاجر مصري: إبدأ بيع أونلاين ببلاش… حرفيًا!

يعني إيه؟ يعني بنديك ٤٠ ألف جنيه (اعلي باقة في ويلت) كل سنة في صورة منصة كاملة تبيع عليها منتجاتك، من غير ما تدفع ولا مليم، لا اشتراك شهري، ولا عمولة على الطلبات، ولا علي عدد المنتجات، ولا علي عدد الزيارات، ولا حتى رسوم خفية لما تكبر.

الموضوع ببساطة إن كل مميزات منصة ويلت للمتاجر بقت مجانية مدى الحياة لكل المصريين ❤️🇪🇬

عارف انك هتقولي وانتو مصلحتكو ايه؟ 
هقولك: اللي فاهم الايكومرس كويس، عارف إن الفلوس بتيجي من الخدمات الحوالين المتجر مش من الاشتراكات. شوبيفاي نفسها ١٠٪ بس من دخلها اشتراكات. 

فا احنا هنكسب من كل اوردر انت بتشحنو عن طريق شحنات ويلت (ولو مش عايز يستعمل شحنات ويلت مافيش مشكلة) وعن كل اوردر اتدفع عن طريق ويلت باي ال هتخليك تستقبل فيزا وماستركارد وميزة وابل باي وكل المحافظ وفاليو وحتي إنستا باي بكل بساطه وال هتكون متاحة قريب جدا في مصر 

 ومش معني ان المنصة مجانية انك هتدفع زيادة في الشحن او الدفع اونلين لا خالص هنحاول نديك اسعار تنافسية والاهم انك تدير كل حاجه من مكان واحد حتي كل فلوسك عن طريق محفظة ويلت ال هينزل عليها فلوسك من الدفع عند الاستلام او الدفع اونلاين

بكل بساطه احنا بنعمل فلوس لما انت تعمل فلوس ومش باخدها منك لا باخدها من الشركاء ال انت كده كده هتستعملهم 

إحنا بنعمل ده عشان:
 ✔️نساعد كل تاجر مصري يدخل السوق الأونلاين بقوة.
 ✔️نبني منصة مصرية نفتخر بيها وننافس بيها بره.

إحنا ضحّينا بالاشتراك الشهري… وانت دورك تضحي بشوبيفاي أو بوو كومرس، وتدي فرصة للمنتج المصري يكبر وينافس.

أحنا هننجح لما انت تنجح 💪
وجمبك دايمًا،

posts.content:
🌟 AI: The Ultimate Marketing Game Changer 🌟

In a world where change is the only constant, embracing innovation is no longer optional—it’s essential. Dr. Deepak Renganathan ‘s book, AI: The Ultimate Marketing Game Changer, dives deep into how artificial intelligence is transforming the marketing landscape, redefining business processes, and creating unparalleled opportunities for growth.

From understanding the paradigm shift AI brings to marketing to tackling real-world challenges, this book is a must-read for anyone passionate about staying ahead in this AI-driven era. Whether you’re a marketer, entrepreneur, or AI enthusiast, you’ll find invaluable insights to shape your strategies and adapt to the evolving dynamics of technology and consumer behavior.

What I loved most about this book is its balance between opportunities and challenges. Dr. Deepak explains how businesses can harness AI to streamline processes, create engaging content, and redefine customer experiences—all while addressing the hurdles of adaptation, data readiness, and ethical implementation.

And here’s the best part: Dr. Deepak’s expertise doesn’t end with this book. Dive even deeper into the fascinating world of AI by exploring his YouTube channel—Deep-Verse AI.

https://lnkd.in/d85PWA97

Packed with insightful videos, it’s a treasure trove for anyone eager to understand and leverage AI for personal and professional success.

💡 My takeaway? Businesses that adapt to transformative changes will not just survive but thrive. Let’s keep learning, adapting, and innovating—because the future belongs to those who embrace it.

Thank you Dr. Deepak Renganathan for bringing this to life.

posts.content:
The Power of Appreciation in the Workplace

A simple act of recognition can go a long way in motivating a team. This week, my small but mighty Alumni Relations team successfully executed a memorable alumni reunion, welcoming over 250 graduates and distinguished guests, including VIPs from the diplomatic and government sectors. It was a milestone event that required dedication, teamwork, resourcefulness, perseverance and a true passion for alumni engagement.

Today, in a wonderful and unexpected gesture, our boss Prof. Hussain Al-Ahmad, FIET,SMIEEE, C.Eng. surprised us with a thank-you cake—a thoughtful recognition of our hard work. This small but meaningful act reinforced a powerful lesson: when leaders appreciate and acknowledge their teams, it fosters motivation, commitment, and a sense of belonging.

A big thank you to my team Hiba Daghlas Youssef Haji @mohammed abbas Sophia Nicole Jerez for their unwavering efforts and to our leadership for valuing and celebrating hard work. Gratitude is a simple yet powerful leadership tool!

hashtag
#BhatSmile (But Smile)

39. To cap it all

Two years ago, someone gave me a colourful bucket hat. I wear it sometimes, and my wife has told me more than once that I look weird in it.

"You are a 62 year old retired Tata man", she said, "such a loud and jazzy cap does not suit you at all." And then she added - "But then it is your head, after all."

I told her that these colourful caps were very popular with people of all ages, everywhere. As an example of this, I pointed out - "Take a look at these pictures of people on the beaches of Hawaii. They are wearing these sort of coloured caps all the time."

A few days later, my wife came back from a shopping expedition to Westside with her own bucket cap, which had checks in blue and grey. I thought that this was my chance to get back at her.

"So if you thought these colourful caps are weird, why have you bought one now?", I asked her.

She responded immediately - "Harish, I remembered what you had told me about people wearing these caps on the beaches of Hawaii. And I found this beautiful cap at Westside for just Rs. 499. So I bought it."

And then she added - "Now, both of us have these caps, so we are well prepared for our Hawaii holiday. There is only one step left now - for you to book our tickets to Hawaii. And by the way, I am fine with Mauritius as well. But can we please fly business class this time?"

I thought of my depleting credit card, and wondered why I had ever brought up the topic of these caps today. But I also paused for a moment to consider what my wife had achieved - never before had anyone in the world got such a high return on investment (ROI) by buying a small coloured hat.

So be very careful about the subjects that you bring up with your partner. They can have unintended consequences. Wish you a wonderful weekend, wherever you are - in Mumbai or Bangalore or Delhi or Hawaii.

Look forward to your kind comments. Words of consolation are also welcome. Thank you.

(Note : This is, for better or worse, a near-real-life story and not a promotional post for Westside. Having said that, I must add the disclaimer that Westside is my wife’s and my own favourite lifestyle store.)

hashtag

hashtag

posts.content:
Are the promised "global roles" in India's booming GCC sector more hype than reality?

India is now home to over 1,700 Global Capability Centers employing nearly 2 million professionals. These centers have evolved from cost-saving units into sophisticated innovation hubs driving global R&D and AI initiatives. However, does this growth translate into genuine global leadership roles and strategic decision-making authority for professionals in India?

While capabilities have advanced, many GCCs still primarily function as complex back-office operations, with P&L ownership and key strategic decisions resting at global headquarters. 

In my new article, "Reality Check: Are Global Roles in Indian GCCs Just Hype?", I delve into this disconnect. I explore the data behind the promises, examine sectoral differences, and discuss what it takes for a GCC to truly become a center of excellence.

For a comprehensive analysis of the real opportunities and challenges within India's GCC landscape, read the full article here

posts.content:
After a spectacular ~3.5 Years, I exited DAMAC Group and it’s hard to put this chapter into words. It was indeed a great learning journey full of ups & downs. It expanded my knowledge across tools, technologies, processes, and leadership in a way that accelerated my learning more than the previous decade did. I leave with gratitude, for the experiments, the pressure, the people, and the trust placed in me during a time of transformation and exponential growth. I would like to place on record my sincere thanks to the great team I had the privilege to lead who really were the core drivers of all the successes that came along the way.

To the leadership, thank you for the openness to ideas. To my colleagues, thank you for shaping me as a professional, a peer, and a better human being.

As I ease into my next role, I carry this reminder with me:
A diamond is just a piece of coal that did well under pressure.

Last but not the least, the move comes with exiting UAE as well. UAE shall enjoy the most special place in my heart as I never felt away from home. I am truly amazed with the fantastic ecosystem the Great Leadership of this Great Country has built, and the welcoming & tolerant attitude of the people is truly inspiring. 

Friends are forever, so there is no goodbye for them. We stay in touch as usual, always!
