posts.content:
Sometimes the moments that fill us with the deepest pride have nothing to do with boardrooms, promotions, or LinkedIn updates.

My 14-year-old son, Niels, just released his debut single "Walk On The Water". A song he wrote, composed, recorded, and produced entirely on his own. No team meetings, no project managers, just raw passion, creativity, and the kind of determination that reminds me why we chase our dreams in the first place.

Watching him pour his heart into something he believes in—staying up late perfecting melodies, learning new software, pushing through creative blocks—has been humbling. It's reminded me that while our careers matter and provide important structure and purpose in our lives, there's something magical about witnessing pure, unfiltered creativity driven by nothing but love for the craft.

As professionals, we often measure success in titles, metrics, and achievements. But sometimes the most meaningful victories happen in bedrooms, garages or attics, where teenagers and dreamers alike proves that age is just a number when passion meets persistence.

I'm incredibly proud of him, not just for the beautiful music he's created, but for showing me that the best work—whether it's in a corporate office or a home studio—comes from that place where skill meets genuine inspiration.

If you have a moment, I'd love for you to experience what he's created.

🎶 You can listen to his song here: 
https://lnkd.in/dM-gSqbf

And follow him here :
https://lnkd.in/dhtWgMsY

Sometimes supporting young dreamers is as simple as pressing play. (Feel free to Save and Follow him😉)

posts.content:
(بالله عليكِ يا بنتي، هذا مطبخ ينفع لأكلنا وطبيخنا ؟!)
عبارة شدّتني قد سمعتها من رجل سعودي طاعن في السن، تمتاز ملامحه بالطيبة والحياء..

حضرت افتتاح أحد المشاريع العقارية الفارهة في مدينة جدة .. دخلت شقة العرض أشاهد تفاصيل تصميمها الداخلي الجميل والحديث.. 

استوقفني حديث رجل كبير في السن قد تجاوز السبعين من عمره وهو يمشي داخل شقة العرض ذات المساحة الضيقة..

كان يتساءل بصوت عالٍ "كم مساحة هادي الشقة؟" فإذا بإحدى المهندسات تقول له "تفضل يا عم، كيف أقدر أخدمك؟ أنا اللي صممت الشقة".. 

ابتسم ابتسامة الجد لحفيدته وبدأ حديثه معها بكل حياء بقوله "تسلم يدك يا بنتي.. التصميم مرا جميل وذوق.. لكن بالله عليكِ يا بنتي أنتِ راضية على مساحات الشقق اللي زي علب الكبريت؟" 
ثم بدأ يسترسل بالحديث لدرجة أنني وقفت أستمع له ومن معي بكل جوارحنا .. وأدركت كم نحن بحاجة لأن نستذكر هذه النقاط .. حيث أننا كمهندسين ومصممين بدأنا نغض الطرف عنها مع الأسف.. 

أشار إلى المجلس والذي لا يوجد به سوا (كنبة واحدة) تتسع لثلاث أشخاص فقط وجدار عليه تلفاز في الجدار المقابل .. سأل سؤالاً بسيطاً لكن ذو عمق كبير.. 

"هادي الشقة يا بنتي ما فيها إلا المجلس دا.. بالله عليكِ إذا أهلك أو أهل زوجك حبوا يزوروكم فين ح يجلسوا؟ لو حبيتي تعزمي صحباتك، ح تقدري تعزمي أكتر من ٢ ؟" 
ثم أكمل "أنتِ عارفة يا بنتي أن تصاميمكم (المودرن) اللي قاعدين تاخدوها من الغرب جالسة تأثر على عاداتنا وتقاليدنا؟ .. احنا يا بنتي بيوتنا فيها بركة بسبب إكرام الضيوف واستقبالهم.. لكن جيلكم الآن ما تتقابلوا إلا برا البيت .. والبيوت بدأت تروح منها البركة.. نحنا بيوتنا يا بنتي بتتبارك بوجود الناس" 

ثم أكمل متحسراً
"فين المجالس اللي كانت تتملى بالناس الكبيرة والصغيرة؟ .. احنا بلدنا بلد بركة وخير والحمد لله الاراضي موجودة والمساحات الكبيرة متوفرة، ليش تضيقوا عالناس وتصمموا شقق بالمساحات هادي"..

ثم أشار إلى المطبخ ذو الطابع الأمريكي صغير المساحة وقال: "بالله عليكِ يا بنتي، هذا مطبخ ينفع لأكلنا وطبيخنا؟ .. هادي المطابخ خلّت جيلكم يتعوّد كل شي يطلبه من برا .. حتى علبة الفول صارت صعبة تفتحوها وصرتوا تتصلوا على (قرموشي) وتطلبوا منه صحن فول ..المطابخ هادي يا بنتي جميلة في الشكل لكن تعوّد بناتنا على الكسل .. مطبخ زي دا ح تقدري تعملي فيه عزومة فيها المندي والكبسة؟" 

كنت أستمع له بكل جوارحي .. وبدأت ألاحظ فعلاً كم أن التصاميم المعمارية والمشاريع العقارية بدأت تلعب دوراً محورياً في التأثير على عادات وتقاليد وأعراف اعتاد عليها الشعب السعودي الذي يمتاز بالكرم وحسن الضيافة.. 

ثم أشار إلى غرف النوم ليتساءل.. 
"غرفة النوم حقت الأطفال يا دوب السرير والخزانة واسعين في الغرفة .. فين المساحة اللي يلعب فيها الطفل؟ المساحة هادي يا بنتي ما حيلاقي الطفل فيها حريته وح تلاقيه جالس ع جواله طول الوقت لأن ببساطة ما عنده مساحة يلعب ويركض ويكركب ألعابه.." 

ثم اختتم حديثه بكل أدب واحترام..
"صدقيني يا بنتي أنا بكلمك زي جدّك .. تصاميمكم حلوة وشغلكم فنان لكن لا تخلوا أفكار التصميم الغربية تأثر عليكم لأنكم قاعدين تأثروا على عاداتنا وتقاليدنا.. الغرب هو اللي يقلدنا مو احنا نقلده"..

حديثه كان بمثابة درس عميق .. 
كم نحتاج أن نفكر بالتصاميم من منظور مختلف بعيداً جمال الطراز والتشطيبات وتحقيق الفائدة المالية الكبرى بأقل المساحات وأقل التكاليف.. 

يوم الثلاثاء ٢٣ مايو ٢٠٢٥م
الصورة من موقع pinterest لكنها مقاربة جداً لواقع الشقة..

posts.content:
🌟 Milestone Achieved: Casting of the 20,000 m³ Raft Foundation at Safa Two 🌟

I am proud to announce a key milestone in the construction journey of Damac Safa Two—our team has successfully commenced the casting of the massive 20,000 m³ raft foundation. This feat exemplifies the dedication, planning, and precision of everyone involved in this iconic project.

About Safa Two:
Safa Two by Damac Properties is a luxurious residential project located at the edge of Safa Park, Dubai, offering unparalleled views of the Burj Khalifa, Palm Jumeirah, and Atlantis. Designed by the world-renowned De Grisogono, it features two high-rise towers connected by a breathtaking hanging garden. With its unique rooftop tropical ecosystem, beach-inspired pools, and jewel-inspired architectural details, Safa Two is redefining urban luxury living in the heart of Dubai.

A heartfelt thank you to our exceptional Project Management Team (PMT) for their relentless efforts in making this milestone possible. Your dedication is what turns ambitious visions into reality!

Stay tuned as we continue shaping this architectural marvel into one of Dubai’s most iconic landmarks.

posts.content:
While I am not someone who takes to social media, but my many attempts to reach the right people BMW Group AGMC have fallen on deaf ears and hence I had to post this!
As any new customer would be, I was excited to be a part of the BMW family and purchased a brand new car (at least that is what I was told) on 22 March 2019.
Little did I know, that it would turn out to be a nightmare given the innumerable issues I have been facing and the appalling customer service that has been offered.
Right from broken locks, to a faulty cracked audio system (which was repaired 2 years later after I insisted that it made a crackling sound), to SOS system failure, Coolant pump issues, faulty tires, replacement of a spoiler for which I was told that this is not our fault and that the guys washing your car -are responsible to a protective assembly failure, the car has gone into the repair station at least half a dozen times.
I raised this concern with the relevant authorities both at BMW and AGMC and have been told that is COMMON and expected and I was shocked at the arrogance that this was conveyed to me with. 
When I requested for a compensation the explanation given to me was that it is under warranty and we are repairing it- funny how a service I have paid for becomes compensation!! 
Clearly they did not understand the meaning of the word and to add to that the arrogance with which all this was conveyed has me agitated.
If this is the level of customer service a leading automotive brand in the world has to offer then I am pretty sure there is A HUGE issue somewhere!!

PS: As we speak my car is ONCE AGAIN in the repair section getting FIXED and I have again been told that such things are NORMAL, only this time around they cannot blame me for breaking an assembly internally

Many have asked me what’s similar and (more importantly) what isn’t, from my past work life… 34 years Vs 1 year. This is what I have experienced -

What’s similar
1. Keep inspecting what you expect.
2. Getting started is better than delayed perfection.
3. People don’t care how much you know, until they know how much you care.

What isn’t
1. Tailwinds in the sector I work (finally!)
2. Purpose beats process, hands down!
3. Unafraid to iterate, with speed and agility.

A big thank you to 
hashtag

posts.content:
"You're so nice, you made the interview feel so comfortable and welcoming. It felt more like a conversation than an interview."
That was the feedback I received from a candidate recently, and it got me thinking.
As interviewers, our aim is not to intimidate or break the candidate's spirit, but to identify the right person for the role. 
I believe that a calm, respectful, and friendly environment gives candidates the confidence to express their experience and capabilities genuinely. 
Unless you're recruiting for the military then, sure, be intense (😉) LOL, otherwise there’s no need to make candidates feel small. 
A smile, a glass of water, or just a warm tone can go a long way.
And if someone isn’t the right fit? Let’s communicate that professionally, disqualify them from this role, not from every future opportunity. 
They might be the perfect fit for a different opportunity tomorrow.

Let's create interview spaces that encourage, not discourage. You can be both professional and kind.
Interviews are human experiences. Let’s lead them with empathy.

From Luxury Retail to Elite Client Strategy: A Journey Across Iconic Brands.

My career journey has been defined by passion, precision, and people.

Starting with global icons like CHANEL, Bloomingdale’s, and Harvey Nichols, I mastered the art of boutique operations, CRM, and high-touch service excellence. These experiences shaped my understanding of luxury from the inside out.

What connects it all? My belief that luxury is not just a product — it's a feeling, delivered with intention, insight, and warmth.

I’m excited to explore the next chapter in luxury fashion, retail operations, or brand leadership — and continue building unforgettable experiences for clients who expect nothing less.

posts.content:
If you’re looking to develop your skills in Creativity and Innovation, here are some practical tips based on experience:

1️⃣ Cultivate Curiosity: Always ask questions like “Why?” and “What if?” A curious mindset helps you explore new possibilities and see beyond the obvious.

2️⃣ Broaden Your Perspective: Expose yourself to different industries, cultures, and ideas. Creativity thrives when you connect seemingly unrelated concepts.

3️⃣ Embrace Challenges: Treat problems as opportunities to innovate. The best ideas often emerge from overcoming obstacles.

4️⃣ Learn from Failure: Instead of fearing mistakes, view them as valuable learning experiences. Each setback can inspire fresh approaches and solutions.

5️⃣ Schedule Time to Think: Dedicate time for brainstorming and reflection. Giving yourself space to think without constraints can unlock new ideas.

6️⃣ Collaborate Strategically: Engage with diverse teams or individuals. Collaboration fosters the exchange of ideas and encourages innovative thinking.

7️⃣ Stay Adaptive: Be open to feedback and willing to refine your ideas. Creativity is a process of constant improvement.

By consistently applying these practices, you’ll build a strong foundation for creative thinking and innovative problem solving.

posts.content:
In a city with 2,000+ developers, becoming the 3rd largest private developer and 6th overall in Dubai is no small feat.


And it’s all thanks to the people who’ve stood by us, believed in us and helped us grow.

We were able to achieve such numbers because of you. And that’s what we celebrated last night at the Danube Properties 1% Broker Club Awards.

Celebration of the brokers who’ve gone above and beyond to make this possible. It was a moment to pause and say:
“Thank you.”

Yes, others may fly their top brokers around in private jets. However, we wanted to create something more profound. Something that rewards not just results, but relationships, trust and long-term partnership.

Despite launching the 1% Broker Club halfway through the year, over 100 brokers qualified for it. That says a lot, not just about the opportunity but about your commitment.

And last night, as we clapped for every name that walked up on stage, there was this one shared emotion in the room: pride.

Along with the appreciation, the night was filled with vibe, dance performances, everyone enjoying their moment, making the night memorable for all of us. 

This is our way of celebrating our brokers who have been on this journey with us, who deserve to be appreciated, as they are the reason for our growth. 
You are the superstars for us. ♥️

posts.content:
When I took on the role at Danube Properties, one thing was clear to me: 

If I want my sales team to perform at their best, they need the right environment to support them.

In real estate especially in the luxury segment, people often focus only on leads, numbers, and conversions.

But I believe that to sell premium, you have to experience premium every single day.

Sales is a high-pressure role. Most teams struggle not just with targets, but also with things like delayed tools, scattered support, or simply not having the right space to welcome clients confidently.

That’s not what I wanted for my team.

So we renovated the entire office.
Not because it wasn’t good before, but because I knew we could do better.

We upgraded the space for the people who spend most of their day in it.

Here’s what changed:
→ A warm, welcoming reception that sets the tone for clients and team
→ Private meeting rooms for undisturbed, focused conversations
→ A master screen to showcase our USPs with clarity and impact
→ Collaborative zones that encourage fresh ideas and stronger teamwork

Every week, I personally sit with my team to understand what’s working and what’s holding them back, not just to talk numbers, but to listen.

Because performance isn’t driven by pressure.
It’s driven by support, systems, and culture.

Since the renovation, I’ve seen the shift in energy, in ownership, in results.

At Danube, we don’t wait for problems to become patterns. We upgrade what matters before it becomes a limitation.

And the same goes for the leadership, it's about building the kind of foundation your team can grow on.

Does your workspace reflect the ambition you're chasing?

posts.content:
After more than a decade of work, the launch of Khalid Bin Sultan City by BEEAH Group marks a major milestone, not just for us, but for how cities can and should be built moving forward.

Master planned by Zaha Hadid Architects, this freehold, climate-smart development is a blueprint for sustainable living, designed around people, shaped by purpose.

Built on four foundational pillars:

Sustainability, with net-zero-ready infrastructure, renewable energy, and recycled water systems.

Technology, through integrated, AI-driven services.

Culture, blending heritage with innovation.

And at the core, People – with walkable neighborhoods, wellness-focused amenities, and space to connect.

Seven distinct residential districts are each anchored by a central plaza within a five-minute walk of every home, bringing life, services, and community together in one place.

When everything you need is within walking distance, the city becomes not just more efficient - but more human.

We’ll be announcing sales for the first phase shortly. Watch the video below for a virtual tour of the city.

Khalid Bin Sultan City is our vision of what’s next - and we’re just getting started.

posts.content:
Grow green🍀, not build grey 🏗️? 
95% ⬇️ water for vertical gardens👇

Vertical farming is revolutionising agriculture and aligns with circular economy principles. It can be a circular game-changer. 

1️⃣ Water efficiency: 
Vertical farms use up to 95% less water than traditional farming, creating a closed-loop system that recycles and reuses this precious resource.

2️⃣ Less pesticides: 
By controlling the environment, vertical farms eliminate the need for harmful pesticides, promoting healthier ecosystems and safer food.

3️⃣ Year-round production: 
These farms can produce crops 365 days a year, regardless of weather conditions, reducing food waste and improving food security.

4️⃣ Urban integration: 
Vertical farms can be seamlessly integrated into urban landscapes, repurposing unused spaces and reducing transportation emissions.

5️⃣ Circular nutrient cycling: 
By implementing hydroponic or aeroponic systems, vertical farms can recycle nutrients, minimizing waste and creating a regenerative loop.

2 tips for DIY:

🥒 Start Small: Maybe use a pre-loved shelving unit to create your own vertical garden.
🫑 Utilize LED grow lights - especially for low-light conditions.

Inspired to grow?

posts.content:
✨ I had a conversation today with several local real estate agents about our business and our deals at DarGlobal. They were surprised — some didn't believe me — when I explained that we don't just close deals in Spain; but have also sold projects under development in Dubai, Qatar, Saudi Arabia and Oman.

🌍 This is the reality of working with a truly global developer like DarGlobal , a company founded on the vision of providing global citizens with unique, branded and luxury residential assets in top international investment destinations.

One of the clearest examples has been our sales success with Polish and European investors, thanks to the partnership with PLANOGROUP and with the great support in Poland from Michele Tymowski. Together, we are proud to have sold more than 20 units in AIDA, our project in Oman, the masterpiece of our portfolio.

Thank you for your trust PLANOGROUP. We will continue to present the best opportunities to your clients in our current and future projects 🤝

posts.content:
21 Brutal Career Truths
(Accept them to accelerate your career):

1/ Your habits got you here. Change them to change your life.

2/ No one cares about your career as much as you.

3/ Learning to sell yourself is non-negotiable.

4/ If you don’t communicate, others will assume the worst.

5/ Every job is an experiment. Move on if it’s not working.

6/ You can’t work smart until you’ve worked hard.

7/ One bad first impression can take years to undo.

8/ If it seems too good to be true, it is.

9/ Win by doubling down on your strengths, not fixing your weaknesses.

10/ Fear of mistakes leads to regret. Embrace failure.

11/ If no one knows you, you don’t exist. Build your brand.

12/ Big goals take longer than you think. Be patient.

13/ Action cures anxiety.

14/ Blaming others won’t solve your problems (even if it’s their fault).

15/ Not everyone’s your friend. Trust, but always verify.

16/ Hard work isn’t enough; the right opportunity matters more.

17/ Networking is a must—it’s built on what you give, not what you take.

18/ Guard your reputation—it’s fragile.

19/ Talk is cheap. Be someone who gets things done.

20/ Performance isn’t enough—visibility counts just as much.

21/ Waiting til you’re “ready” means it won’t happen.

P.S. What’s your biggest career lesson?

–

♻️ Repost this to help your network avoid these career mistakes!

➕ Follow me (Will McTighe) for more like this.

Crash guard around the column structure with separate foundation could have helped saved the bridge. 

It looks like compromise in design.

Nitin Gadkari We should learn from design mistakes and implement most modern infrastructure design in India.

posts.content:
جريمة لا يعاقب عليها القانون

في رحلتك المهنية، قد ترتكب “جرائم” لا يعاقب عليها القانون، مثل:

 •امتلاكك مهارات تفوق العادي، مما يزعج من اعتادوا على المستوى المتوسط، فيشعرون بالتهديد لمجرد أنك ترفع سقف التوقعات.

 •رفضك الاكتفاء بالمألوف وسعيك وراء تقديم عملك في احسن صورة، مما يجعلك عرضة للاتهام بعدم اتباع التوجيهات، فقط لأنك لم تتكيف مع المستوى الرديء، فيصبح نجاحك عبئًا على من لا يريد التطور.

 •عدم استسلامك للأمور الزائفة والهشة، مما يدفع البعض لمحاولة إسكاتك لأنك كشفت الحقيقة التي يفضلون إنكارها، فتبدأ محاولات التقليل منك وتشويه صورتك.

فأصبح صوتك غير مرغوب فيه، حتى لو كان صوت المنطق. تُحاصر بأساليب غير مباشرة، مثل التشكيك في قدراتك، والتقليل منك، بل وحتى تجاهل جهودك عمدًا. قد تجد نفسك تُستبعد من الفرص التي تستحقها، أو يُنسب عملك لغيرك، أو تُحرم من التقدير الذي تستحقه.

قد تواجه محاولات أكثر قسوة لإسكَاتك، مثل توجيه الانتقادات اللاذعة علنًا، أو وضعك تحت ضغط مستمر، أو التهديد بطرق مختلفة. قد يُساء إليك بالكلمات، بالتلميحات، أو حتى بمحاولة عزلك، فقط لأنك اخترت أن تقدم عملك في أحسن صورة.

وهكذا، يصبح تميزك وكأنه جريمة، وسعيك للأفضل يُنظر إليه على أنه تعدٍّ على منطق “القناعة بالقليل”، ورفضك للعادي يُعتبر تمردًا يُهدد من ارتاحوا للركود.
والنتيجة؟ محاولات تهميشك، التضييق عليك، وربما التبلي عليك، فقط لأنك قررت أن تسير في طريقك بثقة، دون أن تنحني للمعايير التي لم تخلق لك.

posts.content:
“لما الشاطر يمشي… رغم إنه سلّم كل حاجة!”

المشهد اللي بشوفه كتير من خبرتي في HR:
موظف شاطر، منظم، ومحترف… قرر يسيب الشركة. مشي بأسلوب راقي جدًا:
 • عمل Handover كامل، موثق ومكتوب.
 • عمل Knowledge Transfer Sessions للفريق.
 • سلّم كل الملفات والأكسس والـ Processes.
يعني سايب وراه كل حاجة مفهومة وسهلة تتنفذ.

ومع ذلك…
أول أسبوع بعد ما مشي، الشركة دخلت في دوامة:
 • حجم التفاصيل اللي كان شايلها في دماغه والقرارات اللي بياخدها في ثانية… محتاجين 3 أشخاص عشان يعملوها.
 • العلاقات الإنسانية مع العملاء والموردين… حاجة ما بتتكتبش في مستند Handover.
 • الفريق بدأ يحس بالفراغ: “هو كان شايل ده كله لوحده؟!”
 • والمدير اللي كان بيقول: “الناس كلها بتتعوض”… بدأ يتصل بيه:
“إحنا محتاجينك يومين نعدّي الأزمة…”
“إزاي كنت بتعمل ده بالسرعة دي؟”

الدرس؟
الشطارة مش بس معرفة… الشطارة هي سرعة القرار، العلاقات، الهدوء وقت الضغط، والقدرة على ربط الخيوط ببعض. الحاجات دي مش بتتسلم في Handover… لأنها ببساطة جزء من الإنسان نفسه.

السؤال:
هل إحنا بنقدّر الناس دي وقت ما هما معانا؟ ولا بنكتشف قيمتهم لما يسيبوا… حتى لو سلّموا كل حاجة بأدب واحتراف؟

It’s not just the company, salary, title, or perks that matter.

Your growth, learning, and opportunities are shaped by the person you'll report to.

A great boss:

→ Invests in your development 
→ Opens doors you didn't know existed 
→ Pushes you beyond your comfort zone 
→ Champions your wins and guides you through setbacks

I've seen careers skyrocket under exceptional leaders and stagnate under poor ones.

Great leaders can alter the trajectory of your career and transform your entire life.

If you’re lucky enough to have that kind of leader, hold on tight. 

If you’re leading others, remember:

Your team's success is your true legacy.

posts.content:
The Shared Well of Old Dubai – A Business Lesson

Long before the glittering skyline, Dubai’s communities relied on one common well. Families drew what they needed, and the balance was kept. Until a few traders thought: “If I take just a little more, I’ll profit faster.” Soon everyone followed, and the well ran dry.

That’s the Tragedy of the Commons.

Modern UAE Business Parallels

🔹 Real Estate Brokers in Business Bay

 One broker thinks: “If I message every investor 10 times a day, I’ll close faster.” Soon, every broker floods inboxes and WhatsApp. Investors stop picking calls altogether. The whole industry’s credibility suffers.

🔹 Mall Tenants

 A retail shop in Deira Mall cranks up its music to pull customers. Others do the same. Soon, the mall feels like chaos—customers walk out. Everyone loses business.

🔹 Logistics & Warehousing

 A few operators overbook loading bays “just in case.” Trucks pile up, delays grow, and the shared infrastructure collapses. Instead of faster service, everyone faces angry clients.

🔹 Tourism & Hospitality

 One desert safari operator cuts costs by overusing fragile dunes. Others copy. Tourists find eroded, crowded landscapes, and Dubai loses a unique attraction.

🔹 Corporate Trust

A businessman inflates short-term profits, thinking, “No one will notice.” But if every company does the same, investors lose faith in the whole market.
The Lesson for UAE Entrepreneurs

Dubai thrives because it balances individual ambition with shared prosperity. 

The commons today is not a well or a pasture—it’s:
- Investor trust in Dubai as a safe, profitable market
- Shared infrastructure like freezones, roads, and ports
- The reputation of our industries

Businessmen who protect the commons—by being ethical, professional, and sustainable—win in the long run. Those who exploit it may gain a quick dirham, but they risk drying out the well for everyone.

The real winners are those who think beyond their own bucket, and ensure the well remains full for tomorrow.
posts.timestamp:
2h • 
 
2 hours ago • Visible to anyone on or off LinkedIn

posts.content:
Too often, we measure achievement only by outcomes — revenue targets, promotions, market share. But the truth is, the most enduring businesses (and leaders) are built on something deeper: a continuous commitment to learning, adapting, and growing.

Every challenge becomes a step. Every failure becomes a lesson. Every idea — no matter how small — becomes a brick in the foundation of something greater.

So instead of asking, “How fast can I reach the top?” maybe the better question is, “What am I learning along the way that will make the climb worth it?”

Because in business, as in life, the value lies not in the finish line, but in the staircase we choose to build.

posts.content:
We obsess over buyer psychology.

How do they think?
How do they decide?
How do they say “yes” or “no”

But here’s the truth: a buyer’s decision is only half the psychology in the deal.
The other half? The sales rep’s mindset.

Every demo, pitch, and follow-up isn’t just about the buyer; it’s about what’s happening in the rep’s head.
Because the rep’s psychology is the real deal-maker (or deal-breaker).

A sales rep isn’t a neutral messenger of value. They shape the outcome by deciding, in real time:

Whether to ask for the meeting or hesitate
Whether to follow up one more time or let it drop
Whether to stand firm on value or give a discount out of fear
Whether to bounce back after rejection or let it drain the next call

Those are the hidden, daily decisions that don’t show up in a playbook, but they determine whether deals move forward or die quietly.

And this is why sales leadership often misses the mark.

We double down on scripts, tools, and training for technique. But if the rep’s inner game is broken, if they lack confidence, resilience, and belief, the best playbook in the world won’t save the deal.

Great leaders know this.
They don’t just coach what to say.
They coach how to think.

Because sales isn’t just psychology for the buyer, it’s psychology on both sides of the table.
If you want better sales results, start by understanding the seller’s mind.

It’s always a pleasure to attend the annual Construction Week Middle East “Leaders in Construction Middle East Event”. This year I didn’t even have to travel far as the event is being held in the same location as our office. The first panel included an interesting discussion on luxury real estate. The one big takeaway this morning in Dubai’s luxury real estate is that wellness and smart living aren’t add-ons anymore, they are key essentials . 

I learnt a new term this morning which was ‘ROL’. No , not rolling on the floor laughing 🤣 but “return on lifestyle”! It’s not just about luxury finishes, it’s about how a home supports a lifestyle.

Dubai is moving fast in setting the standard for what luxury living means globally, and it’s exciting to see developers, designers, and innovators pushing this vision forward.

For those in the industry , do you think wellness and smart homes will soon be the baseline for luxury real estate everywhere?

posts.content:
Our London office recently had the privilege of working with the esteemed travel journalist Catherine Fairweather and her husband Sir Don McCullin on trips to Chedi Hospitality's United Arab Emirates and Oman properties The Chedi Al Bait, Sharjah and The Chedi Muscat.

Masters of their crafts, Catherine has decades of experience working for leading titles and was the former Travel Director for Harper's Bazaar and NET-A-PORTER while Sir Don has been a war photographer for 70 years and has been honoured with a retrospective at Tate Britain. 

The couple first stayed at The Chedi Al Bait, Sharjah, which sits within the UAE's emirate of Sharjah and is found within The Heart of Sharjah, an ambitious historical preservation project that is renovating a number of local heritage buildings. The 65-key hotel is itself formed from a cluster of restored manor houses and was also the emirate's first post office. Their stay at The Chedi Muscat immersed them in the resort that put Oman's luxury-travel offering on the map. 

Appearing in the US publication Airmail, Catherine's first feature considered the Arabian splendour offered by both resorts alongside their special settings and history. A colourful six-page feature for BOAT International Media, her second commission documents Oman's sensitive evolution into a discreet, cultured holiday destination for sophisticated travellers, where The Chedi Muscat "is perhaps the ultimate oasis" not just nationwide but in the Middle East. Accompanying her warm words throughout are images taken by Sir Don, a wonderful partnership that beautifully showcases the best of Oman in word and image - much to the delight of our client.

Everyone’s asking what this really means for buyers, investors, and tenants. The truth is simple – Etihad Rail is going to be a big value driver.

posts.content:
Foundations in Dubai are a unique legal structure, primarily used by wealthy individuals and families to manage and protect both personal and business assets. Real estate ownership through a corporate entity offers several important benefits over purchasing as an individual, particularly in terms of financial efficiency, legal protection, and long-term stability.

Recently, I advised a client in Dubai and who is a US citizen, while his siblings hold different nationalities. This made inheritance and succession planning a complex challenge for the family, particularly for their children.

After reviewing various structures and consulting with advisors, the DIFC Foundation (recognized by the Dubai Land Department for real estate ownership) stood out as the most suitable solution. It provided clarity, governance, and a framework to ensure a smooth transition of wealth across generations. The client is now preparing to establish this foundation.

We are seeing more clients exploring corporate vehicles like foundations. For international investors in particular, the appeal is clear: security, confidentiality, and structured succession planning.

🌍 Real estate is at the heart of the UAE’s growth story — and two names stand tall: Emaar & Aldar.

📊 In FY 2024:
Emaar Group posted AED 35.5Bn revenue (+33%) with a backlog of AED 110Bn+, securing visibility for years ahead.

Aldar Group delivered AED 23Bn revenue (+62%) and a record AED 54.6Bn backlog, showing strong momentum and demand.

🔎 The contrast is telling:
Emaar dominates in absolute scale, backed by its integrated model of development, malls, hospitality, and international projects.

Aldar is gaining ground quickly, driven by Abu Dhabi’s expanding masterplans and aggressive project launches.

As the UAE cements its role as a global real estate hub, these two companies are not just real estate developers — they are nation builders, shaping communities, economies, and the skyline of tomorrow.

👉 Follow StrategyConnect for more insights on how MENA’s biggest players are driving transformation across real estate, infrastructure, and energy.

posts.content:
I recently had the chance to visit Louvre Abu Dhabi , and it was an experience that went far beyond simply walking through a museum. The architecture itself is truly inspiring, a masterpiece that blends innovation with culture.

What fascinated me most was how the design applies biophilic principles, particularly in its use of natural light. The iconic dome filters the intense desert sun into a soft “rain of light,” creating an atmosphere that feels both calming and thought-provoking. This interplay of light, water, and space makes you feel deeply connected to your surroundings, turning the visit into much more than just viewing art.

For me, it was a reminder of how architecture, when designed with nature in mind, can shape emotions and create meaningful human experiences. It also made me reflect on how the same principles can inspire us in our professional lives, whether in design, leadership, or innovation.
Creating solutions that are not only functional, but also human-centered .
.
.
.

DGM Investment, a community-focused investment group based in Dubai, has been actively engaged in the UAE real estate sector since 2015. Operating across more than 12 companies, we specialize in real estate development, property and facility management, community operations, brokerage, holiday homes, marketing, and legal services. Our commitment extends beyond immediate returns, focusing on creating enduring value and positive impacts for future communities through stable, long-term investments, shaping a brighter and more prosperous future with each step we take.

We are currently seeking a passionate property consultant looking to thrive in the real estate market, with the following key responsibilities:
- Developing new business opportunities and prospecting to generate leads for achieving sales targets.
- Establishing and managing a robust network of brokerages, brokers, and freelancers to drive sales targets and revenue growth.
- Maintaining an extensive database of Brokers/Channel Partners/Individual Clients.
- Collaborating with marketing and sales teams to create marketing campaigns, promotional activities, and sales collateral supporting sales efforts.
- Engaging in meetings, conferences, and events with clients to foster relationships with existing accounts.
- Meeting client relationship targets and KPIs as directed by the Head of Sales.
- Updating the CRM system and ensuring account managers are informed of client changes.
- Coordinating with internal departments to effectively fulfill client needs.

Requirements include a minimum of 2 years of broker or developer sales experience in Dubai, possessing a valid driver's license, and the ability to join immediately. To meet diversity and market demands, we are specifically looking for:
1. Arabic Male
2. Russian Female
3. Persian (Any gender)

The offered salary is AED 8,000.00 per month with a generous commission structure. Interested candidates who meet the requirements are encouraged to share their CV with rhea.gendrano@dgm-investment.com.

posts.content:
A grade 9 student from Karachi has developed a communication app for those who have speech impairment. 

This shows that age is no barrier to coding and app development. Ahmad Jamal has named the app “KyaBaat” which translates to “What do you want to say?” It is the first Urdu app of its kind and will revolutionize the caregiving of patients who can't speak due to reasons like stroke or tracheostomy. 

Now, they will be able to easily communicate their various needs such as hunger, pain, and emotions using this app. The clean graphical buttons of the app combined with clear voices with both male and female settings will bridge this gap. Ahmad has kept the app free with no advertisements as he didn't want to bother the patients with complicated maneuvers such as skipping ads and didn't want the essence of the app to be disturbed. It is free and it is in Urdu so that it is accessible to the entire Urdu-speaking population all over the world. 

Please have a look at this app and give it a positive rating to encourage to continue on this remarkable journey of app development. Download the app from Google Play Store by either typing "kyabaat" or by going to this link: https://lnkd.in/ex4XhRB9 🔗 - Link in story.



https://lnkd.in/eYJNjHgu

posts.content:
Some conversations drain you.
Others expand you.

The difference?
 It’s what and who is being discussed.

The right tables are filled with ideas, growth, dreams, and goals.
Not gossip. Not negativity.

That’s where your future is shaped.

How To Choose The Right Tables:

1️⃣ Listen To The Topics
 ↳ Are they speaking about visions and possibilities?
 ↳ Or tearing others down?

2️⃣ Notice How You Feel After
 ↳ Inspired, energized, and focused?
 ↳ Or drained and doubtful?

3️⃣ Look For Growth-Minded People
 ↳ Surround yourself with learners and builders.
 ↳ Their energy becomes contagious.

4️⃣ Be Intentional With Your Presence
 ↳ Don’t just sit anywhere.
 ↳ Seek out rooms that challenge you to level up.

5️⃣ Add Value To The Table
 ↳ Don’t just consume inspiration.
 ↳ Contribute your ideas, efforts, and support.

The right conversations don’t just pass the time.
They help build the life you’re reaching for.

♻️ Repost if you agree

Credit: Hava Maloku

posts.content:
5 reasons why Palm Jebel Ali is better than Palm Jumeirah…


1. Palm Jebel Ali is twice the size of Palm Jumeirah, leading to larger plot sizes of villas on PJA

2. Palm Jebel Ali has 3 entry and exit points, whereas Palm Jumeirah only has 1, leading to better traffic flow

3. Water circulation on Palm Jebel Ali is better due to multiple openings along the crescent, ensuring better water flow and clarity of water

4. Villas on Palm Jebel Ali have a facelift and look more modern, with sustainability at the forefront. Whereas Palm Jumeirah villas are outdated.

5. Price/sqft on Palm Jebel Ali is 3x less than on Palm Jumeirah, giving you a higher scope for capital appreciation 

Message me now to submit your EOI 📥

posts.content:
When leading a team with conflicting values, finding common ground is essential for success. To bridge the gap:

1. Encourage Open Communication: Create a space where everyone can share their perspectives respectfully, allowing for a better understanding of the root causes of disagreements.
 
2. Focus on Shared Goals: Highlight the overarching objectives that unite the team, redirecting focus from individual values to collective success.

3. Promote Empathy and Respect: Encourage team members to see things from each other's point of view, fostering mutual respect despite differing values.

4. Facilitate Compromise: Look for solutions that integrate aspects of everyone’s values, creating a path forward that respects differences but maintains cohesion.

5. Lead by Example: Demonstrate a balanced approach, showing how to value diverse perspectives while keeping the team’s goals at the forefront.

By focusing on shared goals and fostering an environment of respect, you can navigate conflicting values effectively and keep the team aligned.

The winner of UAE BEST PROPERTY VIDEO 2021 by Property Finder 🥇 Thanks to the efforts of our amazing marketing team and beautiful apartment designed by The Studio by DH ⭐️

This way, we wanted to show the property with all its highlights that make living inside a certain apartment enjoyable. A raw, organic and intimate way to truly showcase the magic of one place. 

We choose City Walk as a destination, as this is one of the areas Driven Properties has a lot of coverage, as seen on Property Finder . By showing this one unit, we are presenting the audience with the opportunity to see beyond the walls of the whole project, by explaining the key features and highlights and taking the viewer on a serene journey.

posts.content:
In 2025, around 165,000 millionaires are expected to relocate globally. The UAE will be the top destination, attracting nearly 10,000, while the UK is projected to see the largest outflow of 15,500. This highlights the UAE’s growing appeal as a tax-friendly and luxury hub.

Each relocating millionaire transfers an average of USD 5 - 10 million in investable wealth, shaping new markets and opportunities.

This surge is driven by several key factors:
🔵 Zero personal income tax and a highly business-friendly regulatory environment.
🔵 A luxury lifestyle ecosystem, including world-class real estate, hospitality, and leisure infrastructure.
🔵 Strategic global connectivity through Dubai and Abu Dhabi’s status as international transport and trade hubs.
🔵 Political stability and safety, making the UAE an attractive jurisdiction for wealth preservation.

posts.content:
Boom ou bulle ? La vérité sur l’immobilier à Dubaï

Depuis 2020, les prix ont grimpé de +70 %. Certains analystes annoncent une correction possible de –10 à –15 % d’ici 2026.

Alors, bulle spéculative ou marché solide ?
 👉 Contrairement à 2009, le marché est structuré et régulé :

- Projets sécurisés par des comptes séquestres
- Supervision stricte de la RERA
- Demande réelle, internationale et soutenue par la croissance démographique

La vérité : ce n’est pas une bulle, c’est un marché qui sélectionne. Ceux qui choisissent les bons quartiers et les bons promoteurs sécurisent rendement + plus-value. Les autres s’exposent davantage.

Vous souhaitez obtenir les chiffres du marché sur cette année 2025 et les perspectives de croissance ? Contactez-moi sans plus tarder !

posts.content:
Pourquoi les millionnaires quittent l’Europe pour Dubaï ? 

Le constat est clair :
–16 500 millionnaires au Royaume-Uni en 2025 (un record)
+9 800 millionnaires aux Émirats Arabes Unis
Ce n’est pas un hasard.

Les grandes fortunes fuient la fiscalité étouffante, l’instabilité et la saturation des marchés européens. 

À Dubaï, elles trouvent :
- 0 % d’impôt sur le revenu
- Un marché immobilier dynamique (+26 % de transactions en 2025)
- Une qualité de vie et une sécurité parmi les meilleures au monde

👉 Si les ultra-riches réorganisent leur patrimoine autour de Dubaï, c’est un signal fort. Et c’est le moment pour les investisseurs belges et européens de prendre leur place dans ce mouvement.

posts.content:
Rentrée 2025 : agir ou attendre ?

Chaque rentrée, on se pose les mêmes questions : faut-il investir maintenant… ou attendre ?
À Dubaï, attendre peut coûter cher.

Les prix moyens résidentiels ont déjà progressé de 20 % en 2024
Les loyers ont bondi de 19 %
Une villa à Emirates Hills s’est vendue pour 260 M AED (71 M$), preuve que le segment ultra-luxe ne connaît aucun ralentissement.
Et l’Europe dans tout ça ? Fiscalité toujours plus lourde, rendement en berne, marchés saturés.

👉 La vraie question n’est pas "quand investir", mais "où investir intelligemment ?"
 Et aujourd’hui, la réponse s’appelle Dubaï.

Vous souhaitez en discuter ? Contactez-moi sans plus tarder.

posts.content:
Struggling to get SEO content that actually ranks from ChatGPT?

Here’s the problem:
You’re asking it to write.
But you should be asking it to think with you.

As SEO's, we need more than just 1,500 words with a few keywords stuffed in.
We need structure. Strategy. Search intent. Clarity.

So here’s the prompt that leveled up my process:

 “You’re a senior SEO strategist with 10+ years of experience.

Give me brutally honest feedback—like a mentor would.

Don’t rewrite. Just evaluate based on search intent, keyword alignment, clarity, content gaps, and user value.

Let me know if anything is unclear.
Take your time—I’d rather get thoughtful feedback than fast feedback.”



Why does this prompt work for SEO content:

You define the role and expertise

You share keywords and search intent context

You avoid rewrites, forcing strategic thinking

You create a loop for feedback and iteration

You focus on depth, not just deliverables


This approach turned ChatGPT from a basic writing tool into a second pair of expert SEO eyes.


Want better AI support for your SEO workflow?
Start with better prompts.

Got one you use?
Share it in the comments—I’d love to steal… I mean, learn from it.

Follow : Sushil Singh

- Double-sized living room & formal dining area

posts.content:
Deals close in hours. Inventory shifts daily. Client expectations are sky-high.

In this kind of environment, the one habit that keeps me grounded, focused, and sharp is this: Daily Review & Reset.

What moved the needle today

What could’ve gone better

What absolutely needs my focus tomorrow

It sounds simple, but it’s what keeps me from being reactive and helps me stay strategic—especially when navigating multi-million dirham transactions, client negotiations, or new launches.

In a high-pressure market, success isn’t about working more hours. It’s about thinking clearly in the moments that matter most.

What’s your non-negotiable habit that keeps you performing at your best?

We are proud to announce the sale of a custom-built, six-bedroom villa on the most exclusive tip of Jumeirah Bay Island for AED 330 million—setting a new record as the most expensive home ever sold on the island.

This rare residence sits on one of just three elite plots and is the only one to enjoy uninterrupted, panoramic views of the Downtown Dubai skyline and Burj Khalifa. Jumeirah Bay—known as 'Billionaire’s Island'—continues to attract the world’s most discerning buyers, and this sale surpasses our own previous record of AED 240.5 million set last year. It is yet another testament to Dubai’s thriving super-prime real estate market and our expertise in representing the city’s most exceptional homes.

A huge congratulations to Associate Directors Ioana Armeanu and Regan Faulkner for facilitating this landmark transaction.

posts.content:
Experience upscale living in this bespoke six-bedroom villa, located in the highly exclusive Mohamed bin Rashid City (MBR) enclave of District One.
A masterpiece of modernist architecture, this turnkey residence features extensive reconstructions, crafted to enhance your living experience. Brand-new plumbing and electrical installations have been integrated, along with rooftop solar capabilities. The property also features a dedicated climate-controlled IT command room with access to a home-wide automation system.

A soaring double-height entry sets the tone, leading to light-filled living spaces with full-height windows. Curated by BW Interiors, the home showcases a warm, contemporary design, featuring imported Italian furnishings, elegant marble, and bespoke hardwood joinery.

The home boasts notable highlights such as a dual kitchen, a professionally installed acoustics system throughout, a private home theatre and future-ready enhancements like EV chargers and a pool chiller. Upstairs, the home boasts six immaculately presented bedrooms, each with built-in storage space and en suite bathrooms, designed for maximum comfort.

An outdoor entertainment system and custom BBQ area welcome residents to the exteriors, where a fully rebuilt resort-style pool also awaits. Furthermore, the home features a walk-in wine cellar with space for two refrigerators, each capable of storing 200 bottles. A wall-mounted wine holder can hold up to 75 more.

The community is built around the dazzling Crystal Lagoon – a seven-kilometre lake complemented by white sand beaches - with eight kilometres of dedicated cycling and jogging tracks circling the community.

This captivating home is just 10 minutes from Burj Khalifa, Jumeirah Beach and Dubai Mall – where a range of lifestyle options await – while other key locations such as Palm Jumeirah and Burj Al Arab are within a 20-minute drive.

Contact me today to secure your viewing on +971561158810 or ya@sothebysrealty.ae

Our Chairman and CEO, Mr George Azar had the honor of attending the 2024 Dubai Majlis in the presence of HH Sheikh Hamdan Bin Mohammed Bin Rashid Al Maktoum, Crown Prince of Dubai and Chairman of The Executive Council of Dubai. The event was co-hosted by the Dubai Department of Economy and Tourism and Dubai Chambers and it brought together over 200 esteemed government and business leaders, as well as entrepreneurs, to discuss Dubai's economic future.

Under the visionary leadership of HH Sheikh Mohammed Bin Rashid Al Maktoum, Dubai is rapidly progressing towards the ambitious goals set forth in the Dubai Economic Agenda D33. The emirate’s remarkable economic performance across various sectors showcases the tireless dedication of our government teams and the fruitful collaborations with the private sector and entrepreneurs.

It was an inspiring experience to witness firsthand the collective commitment to driving Dubai's economic success. We look forward to contributing further to our shared vision for a prosperous future.

posts.content:
I’m delighted to present a rare opportunity at XXII Carat, Palm Jumeirah, the only villa directly on the beach currently for sale, offered exclusively with me.

This extraordinary residence spans 12,162 sq.ft. of internal space, on a 20,088 sq.ft. plot of land on the beach, featuring 7 ensuite bedrooms, 4 A/C parking spaces.

XXII Carat is one of Dubai’s most prestigious addresses, an exclusive enclave of just twenty-two ultra-luxury villas at the tip of Palm Jumeirah’s West Crescent. Designed in a Mediterranean-inspired style reminiscent of Tuscany, each villa blends timeless Italian architecture with refined interiors, high ceilings, European craftsmanship, and hand-selected finishes.

This spectacular home is thoughtfully positioned in a terrace layout to guarantee uninterrupted views of the Sea, Atlantis & Royal Atlantis, while ensuring complete privacy. Features its own lap pool, landscaped garden, expansive terraces, and direct access to a serene "private" beach with crystal-clear waters.

Beyond its architecture, XXII Carat embodies a lifestyle. Residents enjoy round-the-clock concierge and valet services, discreet 24/7 security, and access to world-class hospitality moments away, including One&Only The Palm and Jumeirah Zabeel Saray. From Michelin-star dining to beachfront lounges and award-winning spas, everything is within reach, yet the community itself remains a secluded sanctuary.

The development places equal emphasis on landscaping and detail, creating lush private oases with soundproof fencing systems that ensure total tranquility. Every element, from sustainability to service, has been executed to the highest standards, reflecting a vision of uncompromising luxury.

This beachfront villa at XXII Carat is more than a residence, it is a statement of timeless elegance and exclusivity, reserved for the few who demand nothing less than the very best.

Education teaches you how to play,
Experience teaches you when to take those right strokes. 

Gone are the days when we were taught to focus on education to secure a good job, in today's era education might get you the HR round, but experience only can get you through the rest of the interview rounds for the job. Even if you are able to get a job basic education, the "experience" will teach you how to accomplish to job or stay afloat in this competitive landscape.

For students, it is important they start working as interns right from their first year of graduation to ensure they have sufficient experience and are ready the take a plunge.

Do you think, Realtor can be a good career option in Dubai?
If yes, please share your resume at salim@dubaibulls.com
Note: ZERO SALARY, ( it's 30%-40% profit sharing )
Requirements: 
-Must be at least a graduate with 5+ years of sales experience or MBA with 3 years of sales experience or MBA+Engg with 2 years of sales experience.
- Can work from home.
- High yearly earnings.
- Presentable with good communication skills.
- Entrepreneur mindset.
- UAE driving license. ( If you are in DUBAI )
- Age must be 30 to 40 years.

posts.content:
🚀 Dugasta Elite Partner Program – Built for Champions 🏆

At Dugasta, we don’t just work with brokers – we build long-term partners, empower growth, and fuel success with a structured ecosystem.

Introducing the Elite Partner Program (EPP) – your gateway to becoming part of Dubai’s most rewarding real estate network.

✨ Why Join Dugasta EPP?

✅ Up to 10% commission
✅ 7-day payout – industry-leading speed
✅ AED 250,000 marketing credit upfront
✅ AI-powered CRM branded in your agency name
✅ Your own Virtual Sales Center
✅ Dedicated Relationship Manager for support
✅ Exclusive access to weekly open houses & closers
✅ Full access to Dugasta inventory – Ready & Off-Plan
✅ Priority invites to international roadshows & events
✅ Spot incentives, performance bonuses, and more

🎯 Whether you’re an agency or an individual broker, the EPP is your launchpad to consistent closings, stronger branding, and a better bottom line.

📩 Interested in joining the Elite Circle? Let’s talk.
Ritesh Kumar Rajat Arora GIRISH LILHARE Joshva Thomas
